descripcion: Acerca del empleoHybrid Intelligence, a Capgemini Engineering team, is looking for a LEAD DATA SCIENTIST to join the team in Spain. You will provide analytics expertise to a highly talented team, while participating in the rapid growth and expansion of our client base.RequirementsTo succeed in this role, you should have:A Masters or PhD in operations research, computer science, mathematics or engineering with more than two years of experience in DS projects.Professional experience applying data science, analytics, machine learning and computational techniques. Our work is a fusion of applied mathematics, scientific computing, AI, and software engineering. We deliver ground-breaking, multi-disciplinary solutions for our R&D-driven clients tackling humanity‚Äôs generational challenges, from discovering new drug treatments to harnessing green energy.We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace.Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. It is a multicultural company of over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.What we offer?Permanent working contractRemote workingFlexible schedule + intensive workday on Fridays and in summer (Two months)Social benefits package (private medical insurance, life and accident insurance paid by the company, Gympass, Life -employment and family assistance company-, etc).Flexible remuneration (transport ticket, restaurant ticket, nursery, training, extend health insurance to your family...)Ongoing technical, skills and language training (free English classes for all employees)Annual performance evaluations. Professional development plan, based on your experience and future potential, adapted to you, with both horizontal and vertical growth.Our commitment to inclusion and equal opportunities means that we have an Equality Plan and a Code of Ethics that guarantee the professional development of the workforce and equal opportunities in their selection within an environment free of discrimination based on ethnicity, nationality, social origin, age, sexual orientation, gender expression, religion or any other personal, physical or social circumstance.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoOverview#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, SpainAbout Data & Analytics in PepsiCo: PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our brands are sold every day. Our Data & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they‚Äôve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.Data Science The Data Science Pillar in D+A will be the organization where Data Scientist and ML Engineers report to in the broader D+A Organization. Also DS will lead, facilitate and collaborate on the larger DS community in PepsiCo. DS will provide the talent for the development and support of DS component and its life cycle within D+A Products. And will support ‚Äúpre-engagement‚Äù activities as requested and validated by the prioritization framework of D+A.Position Overview:Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.ResponsibilitiesYour day to day with us: Active contributor to code development in projects and servicesAct as contributor in innovation activitiesPartner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.Occasionally, coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.Refine requirements into modelling problems.Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.Create reusable packages or libraries.QualificationsWhat will you need to succeed: 4+ years‚Äô experience building solutions in the commercial or in the supply chain space.4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control). Understanding of Jenkins, Docker are a plus.4+ years‚Äô experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.4+ years‚Äô experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.4+ years‚Äô experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple prioritiesExperience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‚Äòproduct‚Äô creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.Experience with Azure cloud services is a must.Nice to have experience: Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.Experience with Bayesian methods is a plus.Experience with Causal inference is a plus. Experience with NLP is a plus.Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.Experience with distributed machine learning is a plusWhat makes us different? Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovationEntrepreneurial environment in leading international companyProfessional growth possibilities & learning opportunitiesVariety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeingVolunteering opportunities to help external communitiesDiverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalitiesHave a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to workAbout PepsiCoWe believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization ‚Äì a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoGeneral Responsibility As the Data Scientist, you will work in our global Operations, Sales, Finance, Procurement, HR and Business Units. the power of our analytics solutions based on Machine Learning and Big DataUse agile methodologies to accelerate the development of new products and prototypesHave the creativity and technical knowledge to translate business requirements into mathematical solutions.Use data-driven story-telling and visualization to communicate complex concepts to non-technical audiencesSupport the migration of our analytical teams and platforms to the cloudRequirements and personal skillsIdeally Graduated with a higher degree in computer science, information technology, information science, or similar fields ‚Äì May fit also a Lifesciences degree + Master in Data analytics.Hands-on AI/ML modeling experience of complex datasets combined with strong understanding of theoretical foundations of AI/ML.Strong programming skills in PythonExcellent knowledge of commonly used NLP, machine learning, and deep learning libraries such as PyTorch, Keras, Transformers, SKLearn, Gensim, SpaCy, or NLTK.Good understanding of document indexing systems such as Elastic search or SolrExpertise in agile software development, version control (git), continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD)Experience with distributed computing with Apache Spark (pyspark)Knowledge of microservices, RESTful APIs, Dockers and AWS Container Services is a plusExpertise within most of the following areas: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, federated learning, time series forecasting, Bayesian statistics, optimizationExperience developing deployable code and deploying models in product-focused development under an agile environmentComfortable working in cloud and high-performance computing environments (e.g. AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark)Experience in production-ready software developmentExcellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, data visualization and data storytelling skillsA demonstrated ability to work and collaborate in a team environmentProficient in English in written and verbal communicationDesirable experience in life sciences or healthcare.

This team is part of Adyen's Data Solution strategy to enhance operations efficiency and improve customer experience through AI and automation. Operations AI is a new team based in Madrid; we're looking for trailblazers with an entrepreneurial mindset to innovate, tinker and craft something entirely new from the ground up. Read more about the work of Operations AI here.Within our team, you'll tackle innovative, high-impact business use cases. These include developing case routing for support tickets to precisely match support agents with issues using machine learning classifiers and NLP. You'll also work on different domains such as semi-supervised learning, active learning or transformer-based architectures for deep learning not limited to text related tasks.What You‚Äôll DoYou will be responsible for building and interpreting algorithms that power data products at Adyen. Examples are-Natural Language Processing techniques and LLMs to tackle text classification, sentiment analysis, summarization of Question-Answering retrieval. Real-time anomaly detection based on time-series modeling, including transformer-based architectures of neural networks.Active Learning algorithms to facilitate faster and smarter annotation of datasets.Supervised and semi-supervised learning methods for inference on risk patterns.Apart From That, You WillEnsure efficient data preprocessing and ETL pipelines to create features that feed machine learning algorithms during training. Set up experiments to adjust modeling decisions, perform exploratory analysis, tune hyperparameters, or validate hypothesis selection for the right metric set for each business problem. Report metrics and monitor performance to keep stakeholders updated and ensure a smooth model deployment in production.Iterate with merchants and product audiences creating algorithms that power state of the art machine learning based solutions, and be able to explain the reasons behind the executed inference.Who You AreYou have 4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning Scientist.You have experience developing, training, validating, benchmarking and monitoring machine learning algorithms.Extensive knowledge of machine learning algorithms, including a deep understanding of statistical modeling, and Python development tooling and libraries- Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Pytest, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, MLflow, HuggingFace Transformers, Tensorflow or Pytorch.Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaboration tools.Adherence to coding best practices, including code reusability, documentation, and testing.An analytical thinker with a knack for understanding operational requirements and converting them into actionable ML solutions.Proactively taking the lead in projects, from ideation to deployment, while ensuring stakeholder collaboration.You can communicate complex outcomes with clarity over a wide range of audiences.We appreciate a forward-thinking mindset driven by experimentation and iterative development. A solid foundation in statistics and mathematics will serve you well in this role.Data Positions at AdyenWe know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions; this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!This role is based out of our Madrid office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you‚Äôre from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!What‚Äôs next?Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don‚Äôt be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.Adyen is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!We have an outstanding data science organization, with a mission to enable the highest quality decision-making. We work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.You‚Äôll be embedded in a cross-functional team and work closely with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads and Data Strategy teams.Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!What You‚Äôll Be DoingBe responsible for our end-to-end attribution through optimal tracking and incrementality testing with a focus on mobile and App tracking;Define and audit all marketing tracking across networks (GAds, Meta, Bing, GAC..) including server-to-server. Establish the required governance processes;Drive the implementation of the best configuration to extract maximum value from our measurement and analytics partners (Adjust, Incrmntal) ;Coordinate incrementality tests to inform the true value of our channels. You will define conditions for success and perform the concluding analysis to evaluate the channel performance; Continuously monitor the data-privacy ecosystem and develop solutions to continue to enable the evaluation of tactical campaigns as well as budget allocation decisions;Introduce marketing mix modeling solutions to continuously improve our channel understanding;All of the above will be done in close collaboration with MarTech, Marketing and Data Strategy teams.What You Need To SucceedAt least 5 years experience as Data Scientist/Analyst focused on Performance Marketing Optimization;Experience with experimentation platforms and tracking definition;You have strong experience in contributing to attribution models and how to evolve them in a cookie-less and mobile first world;You understand deeply the latest developments in the different marketing channels and measurement frameworks;You have knowledge of app marketing;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions;Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Good written and verbal communication skills in English;Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Proficiency with analytical tools like R/Python and familiarity with SQL.Nice To HaveExperience with causal inference techniques;Previous experience with Databricks; Knowledge of Amplitude, Mixpanel or other product analytics tools; Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.); Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses. Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture; A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development; A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance; Access to free mental health support platforms; Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.Diversity, Equity, and InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAre you an experienced Principal Data Scientist looking for a new contract role?Our client, who are a leading Aviation company are currently recruiting for a Principal Data Scientist to take the lead on exciting new projects. descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:Our Data Scientists work with stakeholders across all departments within the company. They answer strategic questions and provide insight to internal decision makers ranging from executives and senior management to marketing managers and team leads. They also work with our marketing team to develop data driven insights that improve our overall marketing effectiveness.The Knot Worldwide is actively seeking a skilled Senior Data Scientist to become an integral part of our Marketing Science team. This role is centered around utilizing advanced analytics and statistical methods to empower our marketing team with insights that optimize performance. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will develop analytical tools, conduct ad-hoc analyses, and assist in correlating user activity with marketing initiatives. Your involvement will extend to statistical modeling, investigations, and visualizations, collaborating with various teams to drive measurable outcomes. As a member of the wider Data organization within TKWW, your primary focus will be on constructing analytic models and designing as well as analyzing experiments to quantify the impact of your contributions. In this capacity, you will serve as both a valued partner and trusted advisor, playing a pivotal role in our data-driven decision-making process across the Data and Marketing departments.RESPONSIBILITIES: Collaborating with marketing stakeholders across Brand Media, CRM, Product Marketing, or Acquisition Marketing to provide data-driven insights.Conducting in-depth analysis of TKWW user behavior to identify growth opportunities that enhance couple or vendor acquisition and engagement.Tackling advanced analytics challenges related to media mix modeling, geographic experimentation, landing page testing, and lifetime value prediction.Spearheading end-to-end projects from initial ideation and business alignment, through to measurement and deployment of insights.Assisting teams in defining KPIs, setting strategic goals, and designing and analyzing A/B testing for data-driven decision making.Developing and maintaining reports and data products for the organization using various BI tools such as Looker, Qliksense, Shiny, or Streamlit.Effectively communicating, collaborating and presenting results to stakeholders within TKWW to drive data-informed decisions.Investigating novel methodologies to analyze our data for continuous improvement.Mentoring junior team members in analytic and statistical best practices.SUCCESSFUL SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST ENGINEERS HAVE:A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related fieldA minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data science and analytics roles within technology brands, with a preference for experience in a two-sided marketplace or e-commerce domain.Demonstrated experience and knowledge in metrics and models relevant to Marketing.Foundational knowledge of statistics including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and forecasting, and hands-on experience with A/B testing design and analysis.Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability to write efficient SQL codeAbility to code in Python for data manipulation, visualization, and analysis using Jupyter notebooksExperience in using and building self-service analytics tools.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex concepts to audiences of varying technical proficiency.A strategic mindset capable of translating business problems into analytics opportunities and solutions.A collaborative attitude that fosters a culture of data-driven decision making across the organization.An innovative spirit that thrives on exploring new ideas and approaches to solve challenging problems.BENEFITS & PERKS:Private Health Insurance paid by the CompanySubsidies and grants in training and English coursesWorking 100% from homeFlexible working hoursTax relief options for Ticket Restaurant, Ticket Transportation, and DaycareTickets restaurantUdemy coursesLife insuranceGym discountsTYPS: easy APP to ask for salary advance payments in 48hFree paid hours: use your paid holidays as hoursReferral bonusGetting married or having a baby? We have a gift for you!About UsAt The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU: You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.  You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.  You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.  You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.  You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team. WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:We believe in a wide range of holistic offerings to support our employees so that they can live our values day in and day out. From mental wellbeing, physical health and financial planning, to engaging perks and discounts, we are in the business of celebrating and supporting the Moments that Matter both in and out of the ‚Äúoffice‚Äù. We offer flexible vacation, generous parental leave and prioritize initiatives that support the growth, development, and happiness of our people.TKWW‚Äôs approach to the future of work : We embrace a remote culture and empower our employees to work wherever they feel most productive. To facilitate in-person collaboration, we have office spaces in Austin, TX; Barcelona, Spain; Delhi, India; Galway, Ireland; London, England; New York, NY; Norwalk, CT; Omaha, NE; Portland, OR; and Washington, D.C.--US Notice: The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.U.S. Applicants: If you are a resident of California, Colorado, Washington State or New York City, please email statejobdescriptions@theknotww.com to request your state-specific job description. In the subject line, please add the specific job title of the role you are applying to. Please also be sure to specify your state of residence.OrganizationWHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In more than 16 countries around the world, The Knot Worldwide‚Äôs leading family of brands‚Äîincluding The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, The Bash, The Bump, and more‚Äîhelp people take celebration planning from inspiration to action. When you join our global team, you‚Äôll be a part of a diverse group of individuals passionate about serving and enabling our communities to celebrate the moments that make us.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoVisi√≥n General Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker‚Äôs high performance scientific instruments and high value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. In close cooperation with our customers, Bruker is enabling innovation, improved productivity, and customer success in life science molecular and cell biology research, in applied and pharma applications, in microscopy and nanoanalysis, as well as in industrial applications. Today, worldwide more than 8500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations.Bruker offers differentiated, high-value life science and diagnostics systems and solutions in preclinical imaging, clinical phenomics research, proteomics and multiomics, spatial and single-cell biology, functional structural and condensate biology, as well as in clinical microbiology and molecular diagnostics. Please visit www.bruker.com. Responsabilidades Position Description As Data Scientist, the candidate will be responsible for developing statistical methods for the analysis of spatial genomics data.  Using statistical and machine learning algorithms this role will develop tools to analyze spatial 3D genomic data and integrate it with other omics sources.  This position will work closely with software engineers in the analytics team to deliver easy to use reporting tools to help researchers explore, visualize and interpret the results of their datasets. Role Develop algorithms to analyze spatial information, identify patterns and segregate or group data.  Analyze performance and optimize solutions to enable analysis of big data.  Integrate different sources of information with spatial genomics data in statistical models to enrich the data reporting.  Develop graphical tools using statistical data visualization libraries to analyze the results.  Architect and implement new solutions and validate new ideas by modifying existing solutions or developing new features.  Calificaciones Requirements Proficiency in C++.  Proficiency in code optimization and parallel processing.  Proficiency in statistical modeling and analysis.  Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science (M.S. or Ph.D.) D. (preferred) or Masters with 5 years of experience. Additional Desirable Skills To Have Experience in Python Programming  Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, pandas, etc.  A solid background in biology  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Adapts to changing priorities. Drive for results.  Embraces effective decision-making skills; uses good judgment and can bring closure to issues.  Continually demonstrates reliability and delivery of measured results, executed with a sense of urgency.  Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.  Good process and people skills.  Good business acumen with a positive solutions-oriented approach and ability to build productive relationships.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!We have a growing and talented data science organization, with a mission to enable the highest quality decision-making. We work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.You‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads and Data Strategy teams.Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!What You‚Äôll Be DoingCollaborate with marketing teams in coming up with data solutions to support the optimisation of paid marketing campaigns budgets and results;Support proactively the application of marketing mix, attribution and predictive model in performance marketing channels;Work under ambiguity by translating business problems into data solutions, understand minimum requirements and work on iterative solutions that can maximize business impact and be improved over time;Lead the experiments design, setup and evaluation for both A/B testing and causal inference techniques like casual impact, difference-in-difference and instrumental variables at the highest possible scale;Work closely with the Data Engineering department in the creation of scalable data pipelines while guaranteeing an optimal evolution of our ETL processes, as well on the adoption of new tools and frameworks;Contribute to cross-company initiatives in alignment with our data organization‚Äôs vision.What You Need To SucceedSolid experience as a Data Scientist building business solutions using predictive analytics (at least 4 years‚Äô experience);Experience designing and deploying machine learning algorithms in production;Experience A/B testing design and evaluation;Strong coding skills in SQL and Python;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions;Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Advanced written and verbal communication skills in English.Nice To HavePrevious experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses, in the context of marketing or growth analytics;Previous experience with optimisation techniques (e.g. convex constrained optimisation);Previous experience with Databricks, Snowflake;Previous experience with Apache Spark,Knowledge of data orchestration tools (e.g. dbt and Airflow).Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.Diversity, Equity, And InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionWe are seeking a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our Pricing Data team in our Barcelona HQ office. Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. In our team, data scientists build models that directly impact company profitability by making the different fees our customers pay for their deliveries more optimal and dynamic, while ensuring the fairness of our marketplace. We are a growing team of data scientists working on high-impact projects end-to-end, in close collaboration with engineering, product and business teams. As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead projects that are central to balancing demand and supply in our marketplace, foster growth and impact profitability, as well as our users‚Äô experience. Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, but if you have delivered on data science projects of significant impact, worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary, we are looking for you! The Journey  Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsContribute to one or more of the following areas: pricing, promotions and markups or discounts.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw statistically solid, detailed and actionable conclusionsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. backtesting, cross validation with holdouts‚Ä¶) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, switchbacks‚Ä¶)Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; technical leadership for a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: predictive modelling, bandits-based learning algorithms, causal inference, experimentation, geospatial data science and time series analysis.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modelling skills and experimentation expertise.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (AWS preferred).Solid software engineering skills, extensive experience using Python, SQL, git and with the ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.Working knowledge of agile development.Adaptability, you are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.Strong presentation and communication skills with experts and novices.GOOD TO HAVE:Experience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Experience in modelling demand and pricing strategiesIndividuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings with zero delivery fees on all Glovo orders!üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏èFlexible time off (uncapped vacation days), the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoData Science Team @HeetchLLMs, hyperparameter tuning, parallel computing? Let‚Äôs first get the buzzwords out of the way, at Heetch we care about maximizing the impact rather than hype. Our Data people main strength lies more in their capacity to proactively seek out stakeholders and build relationships with themOur team‚Äôs mission is to provide valuable data insights to Product/Marketing/Marketplace squads in order to help them understand what is going on, discover opportunities, and take impactful decisions that will later on improve the whole experience for both our drivers and passengersThe position will be based either in our Paris or Barcelona officesWhat are the challenges Data Scientists face at Heetch?Navigate through thousands of different datasetsIdentify hidden business opportunities proactivelyMotivate and/or automate data-driven decision-makingImprove our rules and processes around data quality standardsWork in one of the most competitive industries with a challenger statusWhat will you do?Work alongside a Product team and become an expert in your domain‚Äôs dataCollaborate and lead cross-teams data projects, with various stakeholders (product managers, developers, data engineers‚Ä¶)Dig into the product's performance with thorough analyses, to uncover hidden opportunities for growth and efficiency for HeetchArchitect data models and pipelines, to transform raw data into product insightsDesign, monitor and analyse product experiments such as A/B tests, with frequentists and Bayesian methodsDevelop and present actionable business intelligence dashboardsDoes it sound like you?You have 3+ years experience in data manipulation, and a strong knowledge of SQL and PythonYou create clear and powerful data visualisations (dashboards, presentations...)You can communicate effectively with colleagues from various backgrounds and technical levelsYou have statistical knowledge and know how to navigate the traps of experimentation (A/B testing)You proactively detect issues and identify their root cause, by asking the Five WhysYou want to steer the company in the right direction in terms of data quality standardsYou are fluent in English (it‚Äôs the language we use within the company, because hey we‚Äôre an international team üôÇ)If you have experience leading cross-team projects, it will be a plusOur team's valuesTransparency: We discuss everything openly within the team. Our 'Speak up' culture is strongLearn from failures: It's ok to fail, learn from it and try againExperiment things: Being free is part of our DNA, we can try things as long as it brings valueCaring is sharing: We believe in continuous learning and want you to be proud of what you've learned/built. Sharing is a natural part of the process

descripcion: Acerca del empleoADP is hiring a Lead Data Scientist Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets excite you?  Are you empathetic to client needs and inspired by transformation and impacting the lives of millions of people every day?  Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next?In this role, you will work with teams to develop and apply machine learning to digitally transform our business processes and the client experience of ADP's products and solutions. You will collaborate with our machine learning engineers and software engineers in solving real-world business challenges using advanced machine learning techniques. You'll be accountable for something significant: products that impact people's lives.No two days are the same. Everyday projects range from deep learning, research & development, algorithm development, natural language processing to deployment of ML models to production.To thrive in this career as a Lead Data Scientist for the Core AI team, you have the skills to design and implement Machine Learning systems using languages, frameworks, and tooling such as Python, AWS and Databricks. You should have experience building models in the areas such as natural language processing, deep learning, classification algorithms or recommender systems. You'll mentor other team members and help them grow. Our best people in this role are independent thinkers and proactive problem solvers, and as a lead team member, you will be a role model for these behaviors.You'll need to have some formal education in Computer Science or a related quantitative field and know design patterns and data structures. You have the skills to leverage existing models or create new models using the technologies above. But given the scale of our data sets and the complex problems we give you to solve, you will stay challenged and engaged with years of exciting projects ahead-all while growing your skills and progressing in a rewarding career.Like what you see? Apply now!Learn More About ADP At Tech.adp.com/careersA little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. A global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc¬Æ Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more, ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_VideosWhat You'll DoHere's what you can expect on a typical day: Collaborate and Build. You will collaborate with engineering and product teams in an Agile environment to identify, design, develop, and deploy advanced Machine Learning solutions. Research & Development. You design and implement start-of-the-art data products, machine learning models, and systems to optimize the HCM system user experience. You are passionate about learning and applying new techniques within machine learning that leads to innovations.Deliver at an epic scale. descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe are SGS ‚Äì the world‚Äôs leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 98,000 employees operate a network of 2,650 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.Job DescriptionThe Digital Lab Program at SGS is on a mission to revolutionize the way we approach laboratory operations, with a strategic vision to transition to digital laboratories by 2025. This transformation aims to significantly enhance lab efficiency and automation, elevate the quality of service and customer experience, and establish a seamlessly integrated network of digitally automated labs.This journey will propel SGS into the future of laboratory operations, redefining industry standards and solidifying our position as pioneers in digital lab solutions.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESExecute setup and maintenance tasks on SGS LIMS solutions in alignment with the objectives of the Digital Laboratory Program.Engage with global and regional technical teams to drive the implementation of LIMS solutions that support the goals of the Digital Laboratory Program.Ensure comprehensive configuration of the LIMS global template within the Digital Laboratory Program strategy, overseeing the entire lifecycle to facilitate successful implementation.REPORTING LINEGlobal LIMS Rollout ManagerSPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIESTake charge of the global configuration of LIMS.Develop and maintain LIMS test methods.Produce and maintain global LIMS templates for collecting master data on a global scale.Participate in defining governance rules for the LIMS test method structure and other master data elements such as regulatory limits, pricing, QC Masks, etc.Drive and uphold standardization of master data in LIMS, in line with specific business rules.Conduct testing to validate the global master data structure in LIMS, ensuring alignment with business requirements.Ensure adherence to appropriate quality and global processes for LIMS global setup activities.Document the LIMS global setup comprehensively.Collaborate with LIMS support to address issues related to global configuration and methods.Define, produce, and maintain global LIMS templates for data collection.Collaborate with the business and GPO business process owners to design new test methods when a new structure is required.Collaborate with LIMS support to facilitate resolution of LIMS-related issues.QualificationsTechnical high school background in chemistry or information technology.Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in LIMS.Knowledgeable in the LIMS process.Fluency in English; additional language(s) considered a plus.Ability to exercise judgment and adhere to SGS ethics, standards, and integrity.Knowledge and expertise in the LIMS process, including understanding end-to-end lab processes, lab quality control principles, analytical tests, and associated instrumentation, testing report logic, etc.Advanced Excel skills, including the use of Macros.Sound knowledge of IT system applications.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Logical and problem-solving skills.Flexibility to travel.Team player.Strong analytical skills, including the ability to break down issues, find alternative solutions, compare pros and cons, identify root causes, and synthesize issues for fast resolution.Effective communication and interpersonal skills to convey messages and ideas to diverse audiences, including IT Developers, Lab experts, business users, and managers.Additional InformationWhy SGS?Join a globally recognized and stable company, a leader in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) industry.Enjoy a flexible schedule and a hybrid/remotework model.Access SGS University and Campus for continuous learning options.Thrive in a multinational environment, collaborating with colleagues from multiple continents.Benefit from our comprehensive benefits platform.Join Us:At SGS, we are dedicated to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential. Apply now to be part of our motivated and dynamic team!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoMissionBased on best international practices, capture, integrate and store clinical trials information (data and documents) to allow on-going data analysis and results reporting to access efficiently to clinical data of our medicinal products and to allow a shorter decision making process. Tasks & Responsibilities Responsible for performing the necessary internal processes and overviewing CRO activities for adherence to the applicable data standards, quality and timelines, following Good Clinical Data Management Practices and applicable Clinical Trials Regulations, like FDA, EMA, ICH.Review the protocol for adherence to Almirall Data Management processes and Data Standards. Lead the review and approval electronic Case Report Form (eCRF), eletrconic Patient Reporting Outcomes (ePRO) and its corresponding completion guidelines. Management of any data finding or/and processes during trial conduction that implies changes in the standards/processes in alignment with the responsible lead of coordinating these standards. Set-up: Review annotated documents, Data Management Plan (coding, validation plan, SAE reconciliation between safety and clinical databases) vendor‚Äôs technical specifications (from DM perspective) Conduct: Manage with the CRO in order to have data available for data visualization and analysis at the agreed milestones established at contract level. Assessment of the database structure and study documentation review, evaluation of the data quality in on-going basis. Coordination of Almirall data review activities and follow-up or finding resolution with CRO. Closure: Management of the database lock processes, review related database lock documentation (including approval of coding and SAE reconciliation), evaluation of the database quality (minimum requirements) before database lock approval to warrantee Almirall requirements. Provision to CROs of the necessary documentation to perform the outsourced activities according to Almirall standards processes and expectations. Follow-up on target and metrics indicators for overseeing quality and deliverables of CRO Data Management activities. Participation together with the Q&A department in the inspections derived from the clinical trial. Provide technical advice on Data Management methodologies and processes to other departments or areas of R&D and the company who requires it. Analysis and assessment of new standards, systems and processes. Collaboration in implementation and development of new technologies. Meeting with external assessors & regulatory authorities when required.Participation in Data Management Associations, trainings and Congresses, national and international, related to Data Management and Clinical Development methodology and techniques, with the objective of warranting the continuous training and regular update of the required knowledge. Working with Partners in different projectsEducationBachelor degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Life and Health Science (Pharmacy, Veterinary, Medicine, Biology), IT or Degree with specific experience in the Job. Experience2+ years of experience as Clinical Data Scientist or Data Manager in the Pharma industry or a CRO. Working knowledge of CDSIC (SDTM standards). Clinical trials. Project Management and planning experience. Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken) across different levels within the organization. Values and competencies  ‚Ä¢ Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed. ‚Ä¢ Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures ‚Ä¢ Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets. ‚Ä¢ Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique?ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.YOUR MISSION We are seeking a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our Pricing Data team in our Barcelona HQ office.Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. In our team, data scientists build models that directly impact company profitability by making the different fees our customers pay for their deliveries more optimal and dynamic, while ensuring the fairness of our marketplace. We are a growing team of data scientists working on high-impact projects end-to-end, in close collaboration with engineering, product and business teams.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead projects that are central to balancing demand and supply in our marketplace, foster growth and impact profitability, as well as our users‚Äô experience. Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, but if you have delivered on data science projects of significant impact, worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary, we are looking for you!THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsContribute to one or more of the following areas: pricing, promotions and markups or discounts.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw statistically solid, detailed and actionable conclusionsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. backtesting, cross validation with holdouts‚Ä¶) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, switchbacks‚Ä¶)Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; technical leadership for a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The Ride Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: predictive modeling, bandits-based learning algorithms, causal inference, experimentation, geospatial data science and time series analysis.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling skills and experimentation expertise.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (AWS preferred).Solid software engineering skills, extensive experience using Python, SQL, git and with the ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.Working knowledge of agile development.Adaptability, you are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.Strong presentation and communication skills with experts and novices.Good To HaveExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems. At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics. Experience in modeling demand and pricing strategies Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravingsüí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what‚Äôs possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.Job Details:Worldpanel by Kantar is the global expert in shopper behavior, offering continuous monitoring, advanced analytics and tailored solutions to inspire successful decisions by leading organizations worldwide. Worldpanel turns purchase behavior into a competitive advantage across a diverse range of markets including tech, fashion, telecoms and FMCG.ROLE‚ÄôS MISSION:We‚Äôre currently looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our Data Science team and answer client question through analytical techniques.You‚Äôll work closely to both the commercial team and the operations and global Data Science teams.Our ideal candidate should have a passion for discovering patterns from large data sets and will work with internal and external stakeholders to understand and solve the business problems.If you‚Äôre willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that‚Äôll be out of the ordinary by joining us!KEY OUTCOMES:- End to end production of the technical analysis in advanced analytics solutions.- Support and develop new solutions collaborating with the Global Innovation Team to provide our clients the best answer for their business question.- Explain processes and results to clients and internal teams regardless of the technical background of the audience.KEY CAPABILITIES:Your background will ideally look like this:¬∑ University Degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree) in Computer Science, Mathematics / Statistics, Engineering or equivalent quantitative fields.¬∑ 3 to 4 years of confirmed experience in similar roles ‚Äì Marketing Research experience would be a plus.¬∑ Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis and visualization using R.¬∑ Experience working with, and understanding of the detail behind relevant modelling techniques like clustering techniques, GLMs, decision trees, etc.¬∑ Business proficiency in Spanish (C2) and English (C1 Level Minimum required)With the following qualities:¬∑ With critical thinking and genuine passion for consumer behavior.¬∑ Proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.¬∑ Highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within technical and non-technical environments.¬∑ Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions. Permanent contract. The position can be based in our offices in Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Bcn) or Madrid. Hybrid office/remote.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!At Preply, we are continually enhancing the experience for both learners and tutors. To do this even more effectively, we've created a new cross-functional product squad!On one hand, we're here to empower our tutors, assisting them in delivering top-notch tutoring that enhances student retention and overall learning value.On the other hand, we aim to empower learners to keep the flame of learning alive even outside scheduled lessons. Our approach integrates lesson content into self-learning, ensuring tutors stay informed about student progress.Your primary responsibility will involve facilitating how we incorporate AI into the company. Selecting the most suitable ML modeling and generative AI tools for each specific problem and overseeing their integration within the product.What You‚Äôll Be DoingStay ahead of AI trends and contribute to shaping the future of AI-assisted tutoring and AI-driven learning in collaboration with our cross-functional product squad.Identifying user needs and leveraging third-party AI solutions to enhance the learning experience for both learners and tutors.Writing production code and developing pipelines when needed.Evaluate the quality of technical solutions in the area of AI/ML.Partner with the squad‚Äôs Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations.Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap.Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences.Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale.Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators.Effectively communicating your findings to technical and non-technical audiences.Support the technical growth of data scientists in your team or area of speciality.Leading the way in how we use AI throughout our product team. What You Need To SucceedExtensive experience in product data analytics and at least 3 years of previous experience as a Data Scientist.Having a solid understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI.Good and broad understanding of data analysis concepts such as (but not limited to) conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field.Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.).Experience and/or interest in extracting insights, identifying patterns, and uncovering trends from large datasets.Exhibiting strong curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to identify and address underlying problems.Emphasizing a creative mindset and proactively engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.Possessing strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Nice To HaveExperience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).Experience with NLP and Voice Recognition field.Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions.Experience in the areas of recommender systems.Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field.Have mentored others before. Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.  Diversity, Equity, And InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoNTT DATA ‚Äì a part of NTT Group - is a Top 10 global IT services provider, headquartered in Tokyo, with over 150,000 employees.We deliver consulting solutions by combining specialized sectorial knowledge, our transformation management skills, and our large technology expertise (data, RPA, AI, low code, cloud, IoT, virtual reality), to keep our clients, as well as society, a step ahead in this digitally dynamic world.Everything we do is underpinned by our core values of 'Teamwork', 'Foresight' and 'Clients First'.Our shared leadership principles of Collaboration, Engagement and Curiosity help us build a community where our people are equipped with the best resources to face new challenges.We're excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist passionate about revolutionizing the Public Sector in Spain. Utilizing cutting-edge data and analytics, you'll be at the forefront of improving decision-making processes in a field that impacts lives daily.Your Impact:Diverse Clientele: Collaborate with national, regional, and local governments and International Organizations to improve public services in Education, Mobility, Employment, Security, Health, Fraud-detection, etc. Innovation Hub: Leverage AI and advanced analytics to transform public services from end-to-end.Strategic Locations: Choose from vibrant cities - Madrid, Barcelona, or Seville, with the option for remote working.Your Expertise:Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field. Specialized Knowledge: AI, Data Science, Business Analytics.Professional Experience: Proven track record as a Data Scientist/Statistician with experience/interest in Public Sector projects.Responsibilities:Analytics Consulting: Translate complex public services needs and challenges into actionable analytical solutions. Data Mastery: Proficient in data analysis, including descriptive/exploratory statistics and ML model deployment.Leadership Role: Manage and coordinate a dynamic team of 2-3 professionals.Skills & Proficiencies:Technical Acumen: Strong in Machine Learning, Python/R, SQL, and data visualization. Apply now and join us in shaping the future of public services with data-driven excellence!
