descripcion: Acerca del empleoTUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Customer Hub & Common Analytics Domain is a global team within TUI technology responsible for Marketing & Technology Analytics. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.At TUI we are ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.The Machine Learn Engineer is responsible to Develop, implement, and maintain machine learning models and algorithm working closely with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into production systems.About The JobAs a Machine Learning Operations Engineer your expertise will be pivotal in designing and implementing scalable infrastructure for deploying, monitoring, and managing machine learning models in production. Collaborate closely with data engineers and data scientists, contributing to the seamless streamlining of the deployment process. Your role extends to implementing automated testing and continuous integration/delivery pipelines, ensuring the efficiency and reliability of machine learning models throughout their lifecycle. Uphold the highest standards of security and compliance in all aspects of machine learning systems. As a trouble shooter extraordinaire, you will identify and resolve issues related to model deployment and performance, ensuring a robust and stable production environment. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is inherent in your role, aligning ML Ops processes with overall business goals for maximum impact. About YouProficiency in scripting languages like Python or Bash. Experience with containerization tools such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Knowledge of DevOps practices and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and their machine learning services. Strong understanding of model monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting in a production environment. Collaboration skills to work with data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders. Excellent communication skills and the ability to document processes. Experience with model versioning and model registry tools. Knowledge of MLOps tools such as MLflow or Kubeflow. Understanding of security practices in machine learning deployment. Previous experience with managing and deploying models in edge computing environments. Certifications in cloud platforms and/or DevOps practices. About Our OfferWorking in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts, special offersMobile working, flexible working hours, and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: TUI Way of Working Health and Wellbeing support in five key areas ‚Äì Health, Social, Community, Career and FinancialDevelopment and career opportunities: We offer a wide range of digital training and international career opportunities.Additional benefits relevant to the local market that you'll be based inAt TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to. We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click hereIf you have any questions, please contact the Recruiter for this role via the contact information included in the advert.Please Note: These vacancies will be managed by an International Recruitment Team and therefore your application may be viewed by TUI colleagues outside your home country.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoTelespazio Ib√©rica forma parte del Grupo Telespazio, uno de los principales actores mundiales en soluciones y servicios satelitales. Con ra√≠ces cartogr√°ficas y m√°s de 20 a√±os de experiencia en soluciones territoriales para grandes corporaciones e instituciones, Telespazio Ib√©rica es una empresa de referencia a nivel europeo en el sector de Nuevas Tecnolog√≠as aplicadas al Territorio. Telespazio Ib√©rica ofrece servicios que cubren el ciclo completo desde la generaci√≥n del dato cartogr√°fico con las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as, hasta el desarrollo de soluciones inform√°ticas combinando Sistemas de Informaci√≥n Geogr√°ficos (SIG), telecomunicaciones y dispositivos m√≥viles.El √°mbito de la gesti√≥n y observaci√≥n de la Biodiversidad, donde Telespazio es ya un actor clave en mercado Europeo (programa Copernicus de la Uni√≥n Europea), un nuevo programa de I+D+i permitir√° desarrollar nuevos Servicios Geoespaciales basados en la combinaci√≥n de UAS (veh√≠culos no tripulados) y sat√©lites, as√≠ como la evoluci√≥n en las tecnolog√≠as de navegaci√≥n avanzadas para UTM y U-Space.En este contexto y a fin de cubrir las necesidades de este nuevo programa, Telespazio Ib√©rica selecciona para su departamento de TI a Ingenieros Inform√°ticos de Software con experiencia como Analista (T√©cnico y Funcional) para colaborar en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, Vigo o Madrid o en la oficina del proyecto en Fuerteventura.El candidato contribuir√°, en coordinaci√≥n directa con el Jefe del Proyecto de Desarrollo, mediante la realizaci√≥n de las distintas funciones:- Soporte en la Recogida de requisitos, an√°lisis funcional, planificaci√≥n y gesti√≥n.- Dise√±o funcional y t√©cnico de los desarrollos a implementar, dise√±o de la arquitectura de sistemas y base de datos, elaboraci√≥n de documentaci√≥n t√©cnica (arquitectura, base de datos, procesos, informes, manuales de operaci√≥n, gesti√≥n y usuario)- Interrelaci√≥n con las √°reas usuarias en lo referente a sus proyectos asignados- Direcci√≥n de los programadores asignados (supervisi√≥n de los desarrollos y pruebas realizadas)Se ofrece: ¬∑ Estabilidad y crecimiento profesional¬∑ Buen ambiente de trabajo¬∑ Formaci√≥n en horario y centro de trabajo¬∑ Teletrabajo parcialRequisitos:Estudios m√≠nimos: Grado universitario en inform√°tica o equivalente. Deseable M√°ster en Cloud Computing, Data Science, Big Data, o rama relacionadaExperiencia m√≠nima: Al menos 4 a√±os en desarrollo de softwareResidente en: Imprescindible en Espa√±a preferiblemente en CanariasRequisitos m√≠nimos:Conocimientos o desarrollo de Servicios web y/o algoritmos con PythonConocimientos avanzados en SQL (Oracle, PosgreSQL)Conocimientos de Front End (Javascript/Typescript)CI/CD (Gitlab, Jenkins)Conocimientos de Arquitecturas Cloud Computing (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)Requisitos deseados:Conocimientos de Machine Learning / IALenguajes de programaci√≥n anal√≠ticos y de manejo de datos en entornos Big Data (spark, pyspark, rspark). Competencias:Proactividad, esp√≠ritu de equipo, disponibilidad para viajes eventualesOrientaci√≥n al clienteCapacidades organizativas y de motivaci√≥n del equipoTelespazio Iberica apuesta y fomenta la inclusi√≥n de personas con discapacidad valorando estas candidaturas en sus procesos de selecci√≥n. La presente oferta de empleo est√° redactada teniendo en cuenta la imparcialidad y no discriminaci√≥n por raz√≥n de g√©nero, raza, ideolog√≠a o cualquier otro motivo.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoROI UP Group is looking for Frontend Tech LeadAs the Tech Lead Frontend, you will be instrumental in guiding our frontend development initiatives, steering a dynamic team towards the creation of innovative and user-centric solutions. Your role encompasses technical leadership, hands-on development, and collaboration with cross-functional teams. Proficiency in Next.js is highly desirable, along with experience in Sitecore XM Cloud, Drupal/Acquia, GraphQL, web vitals optimization, component-driven design, Storybook, onboarding, mentoring, and proficiency in working with JIRA and Confluence.Qualifications:Minimum C1 English level for effective communication with an international team and clients.Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in frontend development.At least 2 years of experience in a technical leadership role, leading and mentoring a frontend development team.Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive web design.Strong understanding of frontend architecture, design patterns, and best practices.Experience with Next.js, Sitecore XM Cloud headless services, Drupal/Acquia, GraphQL, and web vitals optimization.Familiarity with component-driven design principles and tools like Storybook.Experience in onboarding and mentoring new developers.Proficiency in project management tools (JIRA) and documentation tools (Confluence).Soft Skills:Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate ideas clearly.Adaptability: Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and development methodologies.Problem-Solving: A creative thinker who can find innovative solutions to complex problems.Attention to Detail: A keen eye for detail to ensure the delivery of high-quality code and user experiences.Time Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.Process: Please send us candidates' resumes, a portfolio of relevant work, and a cover letter highlighting their experience with Next.js, JIRA, Confluence, and any experience with Sitecore headless services (JSS).Please include details on their role in previous projects and how they overcame challenges.Note: A technical assessment may be part of the interview process to evaluate programming skills.Responsibilities:Provide strategic technical leadership, emphasizing best practices in frontend development.Mentor and develop team members, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented culture.Collaborate with project managers and cross-functional teams to plan and execute frontend development tasks within project timelines.Ensure the successful delivery of projects, meeting quality standards and user requirements.Conduct thorough code reviews, emphasizing best practices and ensuring code quality and consistency.Implement and oversee quality assurance processes to identify and address potential issues proactively.Leverage expertise in Next.js, Sitecore XM Cloud, Drupal/Acquia, GraphQL, and web vitals optimization to architect and develop robust frontend solutions.Implement and promote component-driven design principles, utilizing tools like Storybook for efficient component development and documentation.Facilitate the onboarding process for new developers, providing mentorship and guidance to ensure a smooth integration into the team.Collaborate effectively with UX/UI designers, backend developers, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of frontend components.Why ROI UP?We are more than 180 people of 18 different nationalities who are passionate about our work.Every day will be a challengeThanks to our partner Cobee we are able to offer all our employees a flexible remuneration (restaurants/transportation/daycare...).You will benefit from our flexible health insurance through our partner Alan, who will take care of you in a 360¬∫ way (doctors, psychologists, nutrition...).You will have continuous training from the whole team and different external trainings.You will be able to enjoy your hobbies and social life thanks to our flexible working hours.Fridays are from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm!If it's your birthday, you can have the whole afternoon free to celebrate with your loved ones!Dress code? no, you can dress as you feel comfortable!You will have the benefits of working from home as well as from the office.In summer you can enjoy the long afternoons from 15:00 onwards.We have a great atmosphere!Who is ROI UP?ROI UP Group is a 360 Digital Marketing Agency with offices in Madrid, Barcelona, Alicante, Valencia, Galicia, Lisbon, Mexico City and Bogota, formed by a team of 180 people.Starting with the naming of our Agency, and following with our work strategies and international team, we get involved in the achievement of the client's results to maximize the ROI of our actions with the different tools available in marketing and technology, providing services in 14 languages for projects in Europe and/or Latin America.You can also send us your CV directly to: people@roi-up.esWe are waiting for you!We inform that the personal data provided with the CV or sent to our company in any other way, will be processed by ROI UP Agency, S.L. (hereinafter ROI UP), with NIF B86101995 and address at Calle Orense 70, 4¬∫D, 28020, Madrid.The purpose of this data processing is the management of ROI UP's personnel selection processes, and is based on your prior consent. Your data will be kept for one year, after which they will be deleted.At any time you may revoke your consent or exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, portability, limitation or opposition by writing to ROI UP, at the above address or email dpo@roi-up.es.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (RELOCATION PROVIDED)Location of this job: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote working.)About Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The role sits within the Analytics team under Supply department, where new business ideas, and partnership types are incubated and scaled. This is a broad scoped role, suited to those with a track record of leading small analytics function and/or creating new and high impact business verticals from scratch, from a consulting, sales or business development background with a strong entrepreneurial mindset. You will be expected to perform opportunity sizing on new business opportunities, build high level business cases to justify your proposals and work closely with Product teams to build out new features and functionalities prior to dealing directly with external partners to negotiate and close deals.We are seeking a Manager/Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights, to lead strategic and operational initiatives that create both growth and efficiency for the Supply department. In this role, you will work directly with multiple stakeholders, including executive leadership and various cross-functional departments to successfully implement key initiatives. You will impact Agoda‚Äôs business through exploring new business opportunities, analyzing complex scaling challenges, and improve existing operations.The Opportunity:In this Role, you‚Äôll get to: General: This role is a blend of hands on ‚Äòin the business‚Äô and executive level ‚Äòon the business‚Äô work. To succeed you will enjoy rolling up your sleeves, leading a team and contributing to strategyProject Delivery: Manage, standardize & validate the structure of business cases for product development, headcount, engineering resources, budgets, general strategic & roadmap prioritizationExperimentation: Define success, measure / validate experiments and help ingrain an experimental mindset within the teamsForecasting and Insights: Provide a macro-led business intelligence view to the organization to prevent missed opportunities, surmount obstacles at all organizational levels and drive commercial behaviorsAnalytics & Alerts: Quantitative analysis, data mining and presentation of business metrics; identify drivers and build an end-to-end communication framework based on business value, effort and urgencyProcess Improvement: Work with all teams to drive inter- and intra- departmental efficiencies, optimize processes and prioritize system enhancementsReporting: Build dashboards, internal / external reports and present key datasets to enable all team members to efficiently and effectively monitor performance and prioritize their effortsLeadership: Lead a small team of experts to deliver the above functions and be excited by the challenge of mentoring team members across the chain and connectivity teams What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:6+ years of leadership experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy3+ years‚Äô experience leading analytics, operational, product or other technical teamsExpert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, Python, R, or similarStrong statistical modelling and machine learning knowledgeStrong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the businessExcellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resourcesStrong program/project management experienceBachelor‚Äôs degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)Experience in articulating strategic issues and negotiating with C-level executives ‚Äì experience in leading strategy consulting projects a plusPeople management ‚Äì track record of developing starsAbility and willingness to drive projects independently, working efficiently to deliver results rapidly and engaging the relevant stakeholders throughout the processIt‚Äôs Great if you Have:Master‚Äôs degree in statistics, economics, descripcion: Acerca del empleoThe Information Technology department is looking for an IT Analyst. He/She will be responsible for supporting IT Services and Project Management.The candidate will provide the best IT solutions and related IT projects support. In addition, the IT Analyst will be the liaison between company departments, IT partners, and the main internal contact for the projects.Key Action Areas:Understanding the needs of Business Areas in order to identify and specify technical solutions to support.Analyzes and performs problem solving and resolution on simple issues. Escalates problems (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician.Coordinate testing cycles and support of incidents of Business Areas.Gathering feedback from end users to continue improving systems.Coordinate developers to build and implement technology solutions.Qualifications:Undergraduate degree, preferably in engineering or IT.High level of written and spoken English and Spanish-+3 years of experience in IT projects related to software development in Technology or Consulting companies, or IT departments.Strong technical background: Microsoft technologies (.net, SQL Server, Azure Devops‚Ä¶), web development (Java, API rest) and cloud computing.Experience in agile software development life-cycles.What do we offer?Learn through the quality of the projects you will be working on. You will also have the possibility to evolve through the wide range of courses and masters delivered by our institution.Be part of an International Education Institution that has Innovation and Technology as part of its mindset.Flexible hours and teleworking.Flexible remuneration plan including social benefits (health insurance, restaurant Tickets‚Ä¶).Join Our Talent Community!Looking for an amazing career opportunity, but just not seeing exactly what you want? We are always looking for top talent and we are interested in connecting with you in the future!

titulo: Research Engineer - Energy optimization for 6G networks
herramientas: ['5G', 'Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)', 'An√°lisis de circuitos', 'An√°lisis de datos', 'Ciencias de la computaci√≥n', 'Iperf', 'Red central', 'Tcpdump', 'Wi-Fi', 'Wireshark']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoThe i2cat Foundation is looking for an Engineer/Researcher to work on energy optimization topics within the framework of the SNS BeGREEN project https://www.sns-begreen.com/. to join the Mobile and Wireless Internet (MWI) group.The Engineer/Researcher will carry out experimental research evaluating the power saving mechanisms available in compute platforms used to instantiate 5G network functions (e.g. management of CPU states). The successful candidate will also work on the development of algorithms that can best exploit the available power saving mechanisms to minimize power consumption without affecting traffic performance.The candidates responsabilities include:Develop a testbed for evaluating energy consumption of 5G network functions on existent compute platformCarry out performance evaluation to understand impact of compute power saving mechanisms on energy consumption and traffic performancePropose and evaluate algorithms that exploit platform power saving mechanisms to reduce energy consumptionContribute to deliverables and publicationsThe Engineer/Researcher will directly contribute to BeGreen WP4, attending meetings and contributing to the project deliverables and publications. The successful candidate will collaborate with other junior and senior researchers at MWI that focus on 5G and Open RAN topics and are also contributing to the BeGreen project.BeGREEN project will take a holistic view to propose evolving radio networks that not only accommodate increasing traffic and services but also consider power consumption as a factor. We expected to obtain a mechanism that adjusts CPU power states to reduce energy consumption in virtualized UPF systems. The designed system should be portable to any x86 or ARM compute platforms.Minimum requirements:Bachelor's degree in telecommunications or computer scienceExperience with Linux systems and networkingExperience coding in PythonBasic knowledge on 5G, specially on the 5G Core NetworkBasic knowledge of network analysis tools (wireshark, tcpdump, iperf).Basict knowledge of python for data analysisGood level of EnglishDesired requirements:Experience coding in C/C++Knowledge on CPU management in Linux (c-states, p-states, power control...)Knowledge on monitoring and log tools (e.g. Prometheus, ELK)Knowledge on radio accesss networks (5G, Wi-Fi)Knowledge on the O-RAN architectureMaster or PhD in related topics will be valuedShe/he will be part of the O-RAN team within MWI-SDWN and will report to a senior researcher within the MWI team. You can work from home or from the office, whichever suits you best. descripcion: Acerca del empleoData Governance Project ManagerValladolid / Madrid - SpainHybrid way of workingWould you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true social impact? Are you familiar with the use of data in cloud environments and do you know how to combine the best of both worlds to improve the business of our clients and our own? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!At Fujitsu, we are currently looking for a Project Manager to continue the growth of our team, leverage our product portfolio, and develop new data driven solutions for our customers.As our future Project Manager:You are responsible for the management of a project with high impact, the compilation of the functional documentation, and the coordination of different providers in the context of a project.You work hand in hand with a multidisciplinary group of data engineers to set up the data services, taking the value of managed dataYou are responsible for the identification of new use cases to build a data-driven organizationYou analyze, evaluate, and make use of new technologies, tools, or frameworks around data management.Your profileYou have a Bachelor degree in Engineering, Computer Science. Additionally, you have at least 8 years of experience, working on data exploitation and the development of (advanced) analytical models within the cloud environment, specifically in AWS.+8 years of experience in the management of data projects+8 years of experience in Data Governance in public administrationExperience in resource allocationExperience in gathering requisites to build technological solutionsExperience in driving conversations with customers and leading a technical teamExperience in the delivery of AWS based projectsFamiliarity with Agile Principles and SCRUM frameworkYou were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English, and you have the availability to work in a Hybrid way in Valladolid.Shape your world and achieve togetherWe want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.What is in it for you?When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work.About FujitsuSince being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.More information: www.fujitsu.com

descripcion: Acerca del empleoThis project consists of the full automation of the Markets Business Book monthly and daily elaboration process. Strong Programming skills are a plus. Fluency in English is a must as will be working with our European offices.

Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.Data Science The Data Science Pillar in D+A will be the organization where Data Scientist and ML Engineers report to in the broader D+A Organization. Also DS will lead, facilitate and collaborate on the larger DS community in PepsiCo. DS will provide the talent for the development and support of DS component and its life cycle within D+A Products. And will support ‚Äúpre-engagement‚Äù activities as requested and validated by the prioritization framework of D+A.Position Overview:Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.ResponsibilitiesYour day to day with us: Active contributor to code development in projects and servicesAct as contributor in innovation activitiesPartner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.Occasionally, coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.Refine requirements into modelling problems.Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.Create reusable packages or libraries.QualificationsWhat will you need to succeed: 4+ years‚Äô experience building solutions in the commercial or in the supply chain space.4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control). Understanding of Jenkins, Docker are a plus.4+ years‚Äô experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.4+ years‚Äô experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.4+ years‚Äô experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple prioritiesExperience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‚Äòproduct‚Äô creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.Experience with Azure cloud services is a must.Nice to have experience: Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.Experience with Bayesian methods is a plus.Experience with Causal inference is a plus. Experience with NLP is a plus.Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.Experience with distributed machine learning is a plusWhat makes us different? Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovationEntrepreneurial environment in leading international companyProfessional growth possibilities & learning opportunitiesVariety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeingVolunteering opportunities to help external communitiesDiverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalitiesHave a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to workAbout PepsiCoWe believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization ‚Äì a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout the position: Italki is looking for a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist to join our team. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in analysing complex datasets to extract valuable insights and drive data-driven decision making within our organisation.The ideal candidate should have strong experience in feature engineering, model development and model deployment in the cloud, preferably using AWS cloud services.Responsibilities:Develop and implement advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical models to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and identify opportunities for leveraging data science techniques to drive business value.Perform feature engineering to transform raw data into relevant features for modeling purposes.Develop and deploy predictive models in the cloud, preferably using AWS cloud services.Conduct thorough data analysis, data exploration, and data visualization to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.Monitor and evaluate model performance, making necessary adjustments and improvements as needed.Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning techniques and apply them to improve existing models and processes.Collaborate with data engineers and software developers to integrate models into production systems.Requirements:Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.5+ years of prior experience in statistical modeling, machine learning, forecasting, feature engineering, model development, and model deployment in the cloud, preferably using AWS cloud services.Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries.Experience with cloud platforms, preferably AWS, and their associated machine learning services (e.g., SageMaker, AWS Glue, AWS Lambda).Solid understanding of data engineering concepts and ability to work with large datasets.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to apply logical thinking to solve complex business problems.Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Plus:Passion in connecting with people around the world who are interested in learning a culture through language learning.Previous experience in working in hyper-growth startups and/or fast-paced environments.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoThis is AdyenAdyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.This is Operations AIAdyen seeks a Data Scientist to join our Operations AI team in Madrid. This team is part of Adyen's Data Solution strategy to enhance operations efficiency and improve customer experience through AI and automation. Operations AI is a new team based in Madrid; we're looking for trailblazers with an entrepreneurial mindset to innovate, tinker and craft something entirely new from the ground up. Read more about the work of Operations AI here.Within our team, you'll tackle innovative, high-impact business use cases. These include developing case routing for support tickets to precisely match support agents with issues using machine learning classifiers and NLP. You'll also work on different domains such as semi-supervised learning, active learning or transformer-based architectures for deep learning not limited to text related tasks.What You‚Äôll DoYou will be responsible for building and interpreting algorithms that power data products at Adyen. Examples are-Natural Language Processing techniques and LLMs to tackle text classification, sentiment analysis, summarization of Question-Answering retrieval. Real-time anomaly detection based on time-series modeling, including transformer-based architectures of neural networks.Active Learning algorithms to facilitate faster and smarter annotation of datasets.Supervised and semi-supervised learning methods for inference on risk patterns.Apart From That, You WillEnsure efficient data preprocessing and ETL pipelines to create features that feed machine learning algorithms during training. Set up experiments to adjust modeling decisions, perform exploratory analysis, tune hyperparameters, or validate hypothesis selection for the right metric set for each business problem. Report metrics and monitor performance to keep stakeholders updated and ensure a smooth model deployment in production.Iterate with merchants and product audiences creating algorithms that power state of the art machine learning based solutions, and be able to explain the reasons behind the executed inference.Who You AreYou have 4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning Scientist.You have experience developing, training, validating, benchmarking and monitoring machine learning algorithms.Extensive knowledge of machine learning algorithms, including a deep understanding of statistical modeling, and Python development tooling and libraries- Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Pytest, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, MLflow, HuggingFace Transformers, Tensorflow or Pytorch.Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaboration tools.Adherence to coding best practices, including code reusability, documentation, and testing.An analytical thinker with a knack for understanding operational requirements and converting them into actionable ML solutions.Proactively taking the lead in projects, from ideation to deployment, while ensuring stakeholder collaboration.You can communicate complex outcomes with clarity over a wide range of audiences.We appreciate a forward-thinking mindset driven by experimentation and iterative development. A solid foundation in statistics and mathematics will serve you well in this role.Data Positions at AdyenWe know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions; this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!This role is based out of our Madrid office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you‚Äôre from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!What‚Äôs next?Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don‚Äôt be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.Adyen is an equal opportunity employer. descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!We have an outstanding data science organization, with a mission to enable the highest quality decision-making. We work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.You‚Äôll be embedded in a cross-functional team and work closely with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads and Data Strategy teams.Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!What You‚Äôll Be DoingBe responsible for our end-to-end attribution through optimal tracking and incrementality testing with a focus on mobile and App tracking;Define and audit all marketing tracking across networks (GAds, Meta, Bing, GAC..) including server-to-server. Establish the required governance processes;Drive the implementation of the best configuration to extract maximum value from our measurement and analytics partners (Adjust, Incrmntal) ;Coordinate incrementality tests to inform the true value of our channels. You will define conditions for success and perform the concluding analysis to evaluate the channel performance; Continuously monitor the data-privacy ecosystem and develop solutions to continue to enable the evaluation of tactical campaigns as well as budget allocation decisions;Introduce marketing mix modeling solutions to continuously improve our channel understanding;All of the above will be done in close collaboration with MarTech, Marketing and Data Strategy teams.What You Need To SucceedAt least 5 years experience as Data Scientist/Analyst focused on Performance Marketing Optimization;Experience with experimentation platforms and tracking definition;You have strong experience in contributing to attribution models and how to evolve them in a cookie-less and mobile first world;You understand deeply the latest developments in the different marketing channels and measurement frameworks;You have knowledge of app marketing;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions;Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Good written and verbal communication skills in English;Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Proficiency with analytical tools like R/Python and familiarity with SQL.Nice To HaveExperience with causal inference techniques;Previous experience with Databricks; Knowledge of Amplitude, Mixpanel or other product analytics tools; Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.); Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses. Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture; A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development; A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance; Access to free mental health support platforms; Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.Diversity, Equity, and InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAre you an experienced Principal Data Scientist looking for a new contract role?Our client, who are a leading Aviation company are currently recruiting for a Principal Data Scientist to take the lead on exciting new projects. descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:Our Data Scientists work with stakeholders across all departments within the company. They answer strategic questions and provide insight to internal decision makers ranging from executives and senior management to marketing managers and team leads. They also work with our marketing team to develop data driven insights that improve our overall marketing effectiveness.The Knot Worldwide is actively seeking a skilled Senior Data Scientist to become an integral part of our Marketing Science team. This role is centered around utilizing advanced analytics and statistical methods to empower our marketing team with insights that optimize performance. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will develop analytical tools, conduct ad-hoc analyses, and assist in correlating user activity with marketing initiatives. Your involvement will extend to statistical modeling, investigations, and visualizations, collaborating with various teams to drive measurable outcomes. As a member of the wider Data organization within TKWW, your primary focus will be on constructing analytic models and designing as well as analyzing experiments to quantify the impact of your contributions. In this capacity, you will serve as both a valued partner and trusted advisor, playing a pivotal role in our data-driven decision-making process across the Data and Marketing departments.RESPONSIBILITIES: Collaborating with marketing stakeholders across Brand Media, CRM, Product Marketing, or Acquisition Marketing to provide data-driven insights.Conducting in-depth analysis of TKWW user behavior to identify growth opportunities that enhance couple or vendor acquisition and engagement.Tackling advanced analytics challenges related to media mix modeling, geographic experimentation, landing page testing, and lifetime value prediction.Spearheading end-to-end projects from initial ideation and business alignment, through to measurement and deployment of insights.Assisting teams in defining KPIs, setting strategic goals, and designing and analyzing A/B testing for data-driven decision making.Developing and maintaining reports and data products for the organization using various BI tools such as Looker, Qliksense, Shiny, or Streamlit.Effectively communicating, collaborating and presenting results to stakeholders within TKWW to drive data-informed decisions.Investigating novel methodologies to analyze our data for continuous improvement.Mentoring junior team members in analytic and statistical best practices.SUCCESSFUL SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST ENGINEERS HAVE:A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related fieldA minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data science and analytics roles within technology brands, with a preference for experience in a two-sided marketplace or e-commerce domain.Demonstrated experience and knowledge in metrics and models relevant to Marketing.Foundational knowledge of statistics including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and forecasting, and hands-on experience with A/B testing design and analysis.Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability to write efficient SQL codeAbility to code in Python for data manipulation, visualization, and analysis using Jupyter notebooksExperience in using and building self-service analytics tools.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex concepts to audiences of varying technical proficiency.A strategic mindset capable of translating business problems into analytics opportunities and solutions.A collaborative attitude that fosters a culture of data-driven decision making across the organization.An innovative spirit that thrives on exploring new ideas and approaches to solve challenging problems.BENEFITS & PERKS:Private Health Insurance paid by the CompanySubsidies and grants in training and English coursesWorking 100% from homeFlexible working hoursTax relief options for Ticket Restaurant, Ticket Transportation, and DaycareTickets restaurantUdemy coursesLife insuranceGym discountsTYPS: easy APP to ask for salary advance payments in 48hFree paid hours: use your paid holidays as hoursReferral bonusGetting married or having a baby? We have a gift for you!About UsAt The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU: You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.  You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.  You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.  You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.  You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team. WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:We believe in a wide range of holistic offerings to support our employees so that they can live our values day in and day out. From mental wellbeing, physical health and financial planning, to engaging perks and discounts, we are in the business of celebrating and supporting the Moments that Matter both in and out of the ‚Äúoffice‚Äù. We offer flexible vacation, generous parental leave and prioritize initiatives that support the growth, development, and happiness of our people.TKWW‚Äôs approach to the future of work : We embrace a remote culture and empower our employees to work wherever they feel most productive. To facilitate in-person collaboration, we have office spaces in Austin, TX; Barcelona, Spain; Delhi, India; Galway, Ireland; London, England; New York, NY; Norwalk, CT; Omaha, NE; Portland, OR; and Washington, D.C.--US Notice: The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.U.S. Applicants: If you are a resident of California, Colorado, Washington State or New York City, please email statejobdescriptions@theknotww.com to request your state-specific job description. In the subject line, please add the specific job title of the role you are applying to. Please also be sure to specify your state of residence.OrganizationWHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In more than 16 countries around the world, The Knot Worldwide‚Äôs leading family of brands‚Äîincluding The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, The Bash, The Bump, and more‚Äîhelp people take celebration planning from inspiration to action. When you join our global team, you‚Äôll be a part of a diverse group of individuals passionate about serving and enabling our communities to celebrate the moments that make us.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoVisi√≥n General Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker‚Äôs high performance scientific instruments and high value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. In close cooperation with our customers, Bruker is enabling innovation, improved productivity, and customer success in life science molecular and cell biology research, in applied and pharma applications, in microscopy and nanoanalysis, as well as in industrial applications. Today, worldwide more than 8500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations.Bruker offers differentiated, high-value life science and diagnostics systems and solutions in preclinical imaging, clinical phenomics research, proteomics and multiomics, spatial and single-cell biology, functional structural and condensate biology, as well as in clinical microbiology and molecular diagnostics. Please visit www.bruker.com. Responsabilidades Position Description As Data Scientist, the candidate will be responsible for developing statistical methods for the analysis of spatial genomics data.  Using statistical and machine learning algorithms this role will develop tools to analyze spatial 3D genomic data and integrate it with other omics sources.  This position will work closely with software engineers in the analytics team to deliver easy to use reporting tools to help researchers explore, visualize and interpret the results of their datasets. Role Develop algorithms to analyze spatial information, identify patterns and segregate or group data.  Analyze performance and optimize solutions to enable analysis of big data.  Integrate different sources of information with spatial genomics data in statistical models to enrich the data reporting.  Develop graphical tools using statistical data visualization libraries to analyze the results.  Architect and implement new solutions and validate new ideas by modifying existing solutions or developing new features.  Calificaciones Requirements Proficiency in C++.  Proficiency in code optimization and parallel processing.  Proficiency in statistical modeling and analysis.  Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science (M.S. or Ph.D.) D. (preferred) or Masters with 5 years of experience. Additional Desirable Skills To Have Experience in Python Programming  Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, pandas, etc.  A solid background in biology  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Adapts to changing priorities. Drive for results.  Embraces effective decision-making skills; uses good judgment and can bring closure to issues.  Continually demonstrates reliability and delivery of measured results, executed with a sense of urgency.  Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.  Good process and people skills.  Good business acumen with a positive solutions-oriented approach and ability to build productive relationships.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoOpportunity DescriptionThe Industrial Affairs data scientist has a key role in defining, executing data science solutions like, predictive models (supervised, unsupervised), data pipelines or graph-based approaches. Moreover, the IA Data Scientist will drive the development of novel data products within our data platform as well as executing/evaluating the proof of concept (cf. micro apps) together with clients.ROLE REQUIRES STRONG INTERFACES WITH:Client's IA Data transformation leaderDigital Product OwnersITS organizationFit4Future change leadersOther data scientists across the digital DS organizationEssential experience:Master's degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences or a related quantitative discipline and 5+ years of Data Science experience, or PhD + 3years of with relevant work & domain experienceDirect experience with any of the following techniques: advanced NLP modeling, machine learning, semi-supervised, deep learning, graph neural networks, Bayesian networks and numerical optimizationExperience deploying (micro) apps cf. Shiny or FlaskVisual analytics and/or data story telling with Power BI or otherExperience with some aspects of pharmaceutical operations, specially manufacturingExpertise with the core data science languages (such as Python, R), and familiarity & flexibility with data systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, knowledge graphs)Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computational environments (e.g. AWS, Apache Spark)Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skillsExperience working in an agile environmentDesirable experience:Disciplined AI / ML development (CI / CD, Orchestration)Experience with Tableau or Power BIRegulatory, GxP, or similar standardsOrchestration, AWS stepfunctions, Apache Airflow or KedroRequirementsData Scientist Responsibilities:Build models, algorithms, and performance evaluation by writing highly optimized, deployable code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologiesDefine and implement architectures for predictive algorithm for cloud-based manufacturing applicationIndustrializing solutions together with small teams (pods, scrum) in an agile way of workingProficient at collecting and mining data from disparate data sources, and willing to dig deeper and understand the process that creates the dataWork with a data lake as well as graph databases (cf. neo4js and AWS Neptune)Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver AI-based data products to accelerate and data product deploymentsDeveloping digital data products and pipelines for IA that scaleHe/she will be able to generate work product that includes interactive visualizations, presentations, publications, web applications, predictive algorithms, and APIDocument insides and architecture as well as planning using Jira/Confluence

descripcion: Acerca del empleoQui√©nes somosNuestro departamento de Analytics, que cuenta con m√°s de 200 profesionales especialistas en proyectos de anal√≠tica avanzada de informaci√≥n (Ingesta, Modelado, Visualizaci√≥n, Plataformas de datos, Gobierno del dato, Big Data y AI), se encarga del desarrollo de todo tipo de soluciones, utilizando las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as, que proporcionen valor a nuestros clientes a partir de sus datos.Perfil que estamos buscandoEstamos en b√∫squeda de un Data Analyst que comparta nuestra pasi√≥n por los datos y nuestro compromiso de impulsar la transformaci√≥n de nuestros clientes hacia organizaciones data-driven. El candidato ideal debe poseer una mente anal√≠tica, curiosidad y atenci√≥n a los detalles, con la habilidad de transformar datos en conocimiento.Responsabilidades claveAnalizar las necesidades de consumidores de productos de datos y ofrecer soluciones de consumo basadas en el cat√°logo de datos existente.Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios (negocio, data engineers, data product owners‚Ä¶) para comprender las nuevas necesidades de an√°lisis de datos.Colaborar en la definici√≥n de contratos de datos.Refinar las nuevas necesidades de informaci√≥n, en colaboraci√≥n con los equipos de productos de datos y los. equipos productores.Colaborar en la priorizaci√≥n del backlog y definici√≥n del roadmap de los equipos de productos de datosContribuir al dise√±o y ejecuci√≥n de estrategias de an√°lisis de datos.Skills Requeridos y ExperienciaGrado en inform√°tica, telecomunicaciones, matem√°ticas, estad√≠stica o campo relacionado.Experiencia en an√°lisis de datos y modelado informacional.Nivel alto de SQLHabilidad para comunicar de manera efectiva, tanto a equipos t√©cnicos como a usuarios de negocio.Persona organizada, con capacidad para trabajar de manera aut√≥noma y en colaboraci√≥n con otros miembros del equipo.Conocimientos funcionales en Retail.Conocimiento de metodolog√≠as √°gilesDeseable background t√©cnico en herramientas de visualizaci√≥n/herramientas ETL.En nuestro equipo, valoramos el aprendizaje constante, ofrecemos un entorno donde puedes desarrollar tus habilidades en un campo en constante evoluci√≥n. Al unirte a nosotros, tendr√°s la oportunidad de:Trabajar en proyectos desafiantes y significativos que impactan en la toma de decisiones empresariales.Formarte y crecer profesionalmente con nuestro apoyo para mantenerse al tanto de las √∫ltimas metodolog√≠as y soluciones en an√°lisis de datos.Colaborar con un equipo consolidado y con gran experiencia en una organizaci√≥n Data-Driven.Contribuir a mejorar la toma de decisiones empresariales.Horario flexible, jornada intensiva en verano.Contrato indefinido.Seguro de vida y accidentes.Trabajo flexible.Si eres un apasionado del an√°lisis del dato en busca de un entorno din√°mico y desafiante, te invitamos a unirte a nuestro equipo y contribuir al mundo de los datos.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!We have a growing and talented data science organization, with a mission to enable the highest quality decision-making. We work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.You‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads and Data Strategy teams.Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!What You‚Äôll Be DoingCollaborate with marketing teams in coming up with data solutions to support the optimisation of paid marketing campaigns budgets and results;Support proactively the application of marketing mix, attribution and predictive model in performance marketing channels;Work under ambiguity by translating business problems into data solutions, understand minimum requirements and work on iterative solutions that can maximize business impact and be improved over time;Lead the experiments design, setup and evaluation for both A/B testing and causal inference techniques like casual impact, difference-in-difference and instrumental variables at the highest possible scale;Work closely with the Data Engineering department in the creation of scalable data pipelines while guaranteeing an optimal evolution of our ETL processes, as well on the adoption of new tools and frameworks;Contribute to cross-company initiatives in alignment with our data organization‚Äôs vision.What You Need To SucceedSolid experience as a Data Scientist building business solutions using predictive analytics (at least 4 years‚Äô experience);Experience designing and deploying machine learning algorithms in production;Experience A/B testing design and evaluation;Strong coding skills in SQL and Python;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions;Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Advanced written and verbal communication skills in English.Nice To HavePrevious experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses, in the context of marketing or growth analytics;Previous experience with optimisation techniques (e.g. convex constrained optimisation);Previous experience with Databricks, Snowflake;Previous experience with Apache Spark,Knowledge of data orchestration tools (e.g. dbt and Airflow).Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.Diversity, Equity, And InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionWe are seeking a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our Pricing Data team in our Barcelona HQ office. Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. In our team, data scientists build models that directly impact company profitability by making the different fees our customers pay for their deliveries more optimal and dynamic, while ensuring the fairness of our marketplace. We are a growing team of data scientists working on high-impact projects end-to-end, in close collaboration with engineering, product and business teams. As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead projects that are central to balancing demand and supply in our marketplace, foster growth and impact profitability, as well as our users‚Äô experience. Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, but if you have delivered on data science projects of significant impact, worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary, we are looking for you! The Journey  Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsContribute to one or more of the following areas: pricing, promotions and markups or discounts.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw statistically solid, detailed and actionable conclusionsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. backtesting, cross validation with holdouts‚Ä¶) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, switchbacks‚Ä¶)Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; technical leadership for a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: predictive modelling, bandits-based learning algorithms, causal inference, experimentation, geospatial data science and time series analysis.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modelling skills and experimentation expertise.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (AWS preferred).Solid software engineering skills, extensive experience using Python, SQL, git and with the ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.Working knowledge of agile development.Adaptability, you are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.Strong presentation and communication skills with experts and novices.GOOD TO HAVE:Experience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Experience in modelling demand and pricing strategiesIndividuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings with zero delivery fees on all Glovo orders!üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏èFlexible time off (uncapped vacation days), the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoData Science Team @HeetchLLMs, hyperparameter tuning, parallel computing? Let‚Äôs first get the buzzwords out of the way, at Heetch we care about maximizing the impact rather than hype. Our Data people main strength lies more in their capacity to proactively seek out stakeholders and build relationships with themOur team‚Äôs mission is to provide valuable data insights to Product/Marketing/Marketplace squads in order to help them understand what is going on, discover opportunities, and take impactful decisions that will later on improve the whole experience for both our drivers and passengersThe position will be based either in our Paris or Barcelona officesWhat are the challenges Data Scientists face at Heetch?Navigate through thousands of different datasetsIdentify hidden business opportunities proactivelyMotivate and/or automate data-driven decision-makingImprove our rules and processes around data quality standardsWork in one of the most competitive industries with a challenger statusWhat will you do?Work alongside a Product team and become an expert in your domain‚Äôs dataCollaborate and lead cross-teams data projects, with various stakeholders (product managers, developers, data engineers‚Ä¶)Dig into the product's performance with thorough analyses, to uncover hidden opportunities for growth and efficiency for HeetchArchitect data models and pipelines, to transform raw data into product insightsDesign, monitor and analyse product experiments such as A/B tests, with frequentists and Bayesian methodsDevelop and present actionable business intelligence dashboardsDoes it sound like you?You have 3+ years experience in data manipulation, and a strong knowledge of SQL and PythonYou create clear and powerful data visualisations (dashboards, presentations...)You can communicate effectively with colleagues from various backgrounds and technical levelsYou have statistical knowledge and know how to navigate the traps of experimentation (A/B testing)You proactively detect issues and identify their root cause, by asking the Five WhysYou want to steer the company in the right direction in terms of data quality standardsYou are fluent in English (it‚Äôs the language we use within the company, because hey we‚Äôre an international team üôÇ)If you have experience leading cross-team projects, it will be a plusOur team's valuesTransparency: We discuss everything openly within the team. Our 'Speak up' culture is strongLearn from failures: It's ok to fail, learn from it and try againExperiment things: Being free is part of our DNA, we can try things as long as it brings valueCaring is sharing: We believe in continuous learning and want you to be proud of what you've learned/built. Sharing is a natural part of the process
