descripcion: Acerca del empleoADP is hiring a Lead Data Scientist Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets excite you?  Are you empathetic to client needs and inspired by transformation and impacting the lives of millions of people every day?  Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next?In this role, you will work with teams to develop and apply machine learning to digitally transform our business processes and the client experience of ADP's products and solutions. You will collaborate with our machine learning engineers and software engineers in solving real-world business challenges using advanced machine learning techniques. You'll be accountable for something significant: products that impact people's lives.No two days are the same. Everyday projects range from deep learning, research & development, algorithm development, natural language processing to deployment of ML models to production.To thrive in this career as a Lead Data Scientist for the Core AI team, you have the skills to design and implement Machine Learning systems using languages, frameworks, and tooling such as Python, AWS and Databricks. You should have experience building models in the areas such as natural language processing, deep learning, classification algorithms or recommender systems. You'll mentor other team members and help them grow. Our best people in this role are independent thinkers and proactive problem solvers, and as a lead team member, you will be a role model for these behaviors.You'll need to have some formal education in Computer Science or a related quantitative field and know design patterns and data structures. You have the skills to leverage existing models or create new models using the technologies above. But given the scale of our data sets and the complex problems we give you to solve, you will stay challenged and engaged with years of exciting projects ahead-all while growing your skills and progressing in a rewarding career.Like what you see? Apply now!Learn More About ADP At Tech.adp.com/careersA little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. A global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc¬Æ Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more, ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_VideosWhat You'll DoHere's what you can expect on a typical day: Collaborate and Build. You will collaborate with engineering and product teams in an Agile environment to identify, design, develop, and deploy advanced Machine Learning solutions. Research & Development. You design and implement start-of-the-art data products, machine learning models, and systems to optimize the HCM system user experience. You are passionate about learning and applying new techniques within machine learning that leads to innovations.Deliver at an epic scale. You write pristine code and documentation, champion and define best practices to produce highly adaptive, high-performing, continuous learning AI models/systems.Teamwork and mentorship. You will be part of a thriving team, where you give other team members the space to balance the ability to think independently and creatively while also working together as a team. You'll provide mentorship to them get familiar with the team, environment, and resources. Once they are comfortable and confident, you will give them more challenges to take on.To Succeed In This RoleEducation. You have a bachelor's degree (OR equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or a related field. Experience. You have 6-8 years of experience in relevant skills gained and developed in the same or similar role. Communication. You are an advanced English language speaker. Technical skills. You have fluency in Python-including popular data science packages (pandas, sklearn, etc.), a strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and methods used for data science and machine learning, and familiarity with natural language processing. Nice To Have (optional)Master's degree in computer science, engineering, math, or a related fieldKnowledge of generative and embedding models as well as deep learning frameworks such as PytorchExposure to Databricks platform, MLflow, and/or Jupyter notebooksUnderstanding of data products (recommender systems, classifiers, chatbots, etc.)Experience with AWS cloud solutions (S3, Glue, Lambda, Step, SageMaker) and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.You'll Love Working Here Because You CanTeam collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to net out the best solution.Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to navigating change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft.Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation.Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.What are you waiting for? Apply today! Find out why people come to ADP and why they stay: https://youtu.be/ODb8lxBrxrY (ADA version: https://youtu.be/IQjUCA8SOoA )Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP's culture and our full set of values.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe are SGS ‚Äì the world‚Äôs leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 98,000 employees operate a network of 2,650 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.Job DescriptionThe Digital Lab Program at SGS is on a mission to revolutionize the way we approach laboratory operations, with a strategic vision to transition to digital laboratories by 2025. This transformation aims to significantly enhance lab efficiency and automation, elevate the quality of service and customer experience, and establish a seamlessly integrated network of digitally automated labs.This journey will propel SGS into the future of laboratory operations, redefining industry standards and solidifying our position as pioneers in digital lab solutions.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESExecute setup and maintenance tasks on SGS LIMS solutions in alignment with the objectives of the Digital Laboratory Program.Engage with global and regional technical teams to drive the implementation of LIMS solutions that support the goals of the Digital Laboratory Program.Ensure comprehensive configuration of the LIMS global template within the Digital Laboratory Program strategy, overseeing the entire lifecycle to facilitate successful implementation.REPORTING LINEGlobal LIMS Rollout ManagerSPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIESTake charge of the global configuration of LIMS.Develop and maintain LIMS test methods.Produce and maintain global LIMS templates for collecting master data on a global scale.Participate in defining governance rules for the LIMS test method structure and other master data elements such as regulatory limits, pricing, QC Masks, etc.Drive and uphold standardization of master data in LIMS, in line with specific business rules.Conduct testing to validate the global master data structure in LIMS, ensuring alignment with business requirements.Ensure adherence to appropriate quality and global processes for LIMS global setup activities.Document the LIMS global setup comprehensively.Collaborate with LIMS support to address issues related to global configuration and methods.Define, produce, and maintain global LIMS templates for data collection.Collaborate with the business and GPO business process owners to design new test methods when a new structure is required.Collaborate with LIMS support to facilitate resolution of LIMS-related issues.QualificationsTechnical high school background in chemistry or information technology.Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in LIMS.Knowledgeable in the LIMS process.Fluency in English; additional language(s) considered a plus.Ability to exercise judgment and adhere to SGS ethics, standards, and integrity.Knowledge and expertise in the LIMS process, including understanding end-to-end lab processes, lab quality control principles, analytical tests, and associated instrumentation, testing report logic, etc.Advanced Excel skills, including the use of Macros.Sound knowledge of IT system applications.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Logical and problem-solving skills.Flexibility to travel.Team player.Strong analytical skills, including the ability to break down issues, find alternative solutions, compare pros and cons, identify root causes, and synthesize issues for fast resolution.Effective communication and interpersonal skills to convey messages and ideas to diverse audiences, including IT Developers, Lab experts, business users, and managers.Additional InformationWhy SGS?Join a globally recognized and stable company, a leader in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) industry.Enjoy a flexible schedule and a hybrid/remotework model.Access SGS University and Campus for continuous learning options.Thrive in a multinational environment, collaborating with colleagues from multiple continents.Benefit from our comprehensive benefits platform.Join Us:At SGS, we are dedicated to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential. Apply now to be part of our motivated and dynamic team!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoMissionBased on best international practices, capture, integrate and store clinical trials information (data and documents) to allow on-going data analysis and results reporting to access efficiently to clinical data of our medicinal products and to allow a shorter decision making process. Tasks & Responsibilities Responsible for performing the necessary internal processes and overviewing CRO activities for adherence to the applicable data standards, quality and timelines, following Good Clinical Data Management Practices and applicable Clinical Trials Regulations, like FDA, EMA, ICH.Review the protocol for adherence to Almirall Data Management processes and Data Standards. Lead the review and approval electronic Case Report Form (eCRF), eletrconic Patient Reporting Outcomes (ePRO) and its corresponding completion guidelines. Management of any data finding or/and processes during trial conduction that implies changes in the standards/processes in alignment with the responsible lead of coordinating these standards. Set-up: Review annotated documents, Data Management Plan (coding, validation plan, SAE reconciliation between safety and clinical databases) vendor‚Äôs technical specifications (from DM perspective) Conduct: Manage with the CRO in order to have data available for data visualization and analysis at the agreed milestones established at contract level. Assessment of the database structure and study documentation review, evaluation of the data quality in on-going basis. Coordination of Almirall data review activities and follow-up or finding resolution with CRO. Closure: Management of the database lock processes, review related database lock documentation (including approval of coding and SAE reconciliation), evaluation of the database quality (minimum requirements) before database lock approval to warrantee Almirall requirements. Provision to CROs of the necessary documentation to perform the outsourced activities according to Almirall standards processes and expectations. Follow-up on target and metrics indicators for overseeing quality and deliverables of CRO Data Management activities. Participation together with the Q&A department in the inspections derived from the clinical trial. Provide technical advice on Data Management methodologies and processes to other departments or areas of R&D and the company who requires it. Analysis and assessment of new standards, systems and processes. Collaboration in implementation and development of new technologies. Meeting with external assessors & regulatory authorities when required.Participation in Data Management Associations, trainings and Congresses, national and international, related to Data Management and Clinical Development methodology and techniques, with the objective of warranting the continuous training and regular update of the required knowledge. Working with Partners in different projectsEducationBachelor degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Life and Health Science (Pharmacy, Veterinary, Medicine, Biology), IT or Degree with specific experience in the Job. Experience2+ years of experience as Clinical Data Scientist or Data Manager in the Pharma industry or a CRO. Working knowledge of CDSIC (SDTM standards). Clinical trials. Project Management and planning experience. Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken) across different levels within the organization. Values and competencies  ‚Ä¢ Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed. ‚Ä¢ Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures ‚Ä¢ Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets. ‚Ä¢ Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique?ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.YOUR MISSION We are seeking a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our Pricing Data team in our Barcelona HQ office.Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. In our team, data scientists build models that directly impact company profitability by making the different fees our customers pay for their deliveries more optimal and dynamic, while ensuring the fairness of our marketplace. We are a growing team of data scientists working on high-impact projects end-to-end, in close collaboration with engineering, product and business teams.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead projects that are central to balancing demand and supply in our marketplace, foster growth and impact profitability, as well as our users‚Äô experience. Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, but if you have delivered on data science projects of significant impact, worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary, we are looking for you!THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsContribute to one or more of the following areas: pricing, promotions and markups or discounts.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw statistically solid, detailed and actionable conclusionsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. backtesting, cross validation with holdouts‚Ä¶) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing, switchbacks‚Ä¶)Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; technical leadership for a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The Ride Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: predictive modeling, bandits-based learning algorithms, causal inference, experimentation, geospatial data science and time series analysis.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling skills and experimentation expertise.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (AWS preferred).Solid software engineering skills, extensive experience using Python, SQL, git and with the ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.Working knowledge of agile development.Adaptability, you are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.Strong presentation and communication skills with experts and novices.Good To HaveExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems. At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics. Experience in modeling demand and pricing strategies Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravingsüí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoWe‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what‚Äôs possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.Job Details:Worldpanel by Kantar is the global expert in shopper behavior, offering continuous monitoring, advanced analytics and tailored solutions to inspire successful decisions by leading organizations worldwide. Worldpanel turns purchase behavior into a competitive advantage across a diverse range of markets including tech, fashion, telecoms and FMCG.ROLE‚ÄôS MISSION:We‚Äôre currently looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our Data Science team and answer client question through analytical techniques.You‚Äôll work closely to both the commercial team and the operations and global Data Science teams.Our ideal candidate should have a passion for discovering patterns from large data sets and will work with internal and external stakeholders to understand and solve the business problems.If you‚Äôre willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that‚Äôll be out of the ordinary by joining us!KEY OUTCOMES:- End to end production of the technical analysis in advanced analytics solutions.- Support and develop new solutions collaborating with the Global Innovation Team to provide our clients the best answer for their business question.- Explain processes and results to clients and internal teams regardless of the technical background of the audience.KEY CAPABILITIES:Your background will ideally look like this:¬∑ University Degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree) in Computer Science, Mathematics / Statistics, Engineering or equivalent quantitative fields.¬∑ 3 to 4 years of confirmed experience in similar roles ‚Äì Marketing Research experience would be a plus.¬∑ Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis and visualization using R.¬∑ Experience working with, and understanding of the detail behind relevant modelling techniques like clustering techniques, GLMs, decision trees, etc.¬∑ Business proficiency in Spanish (C2) and English (C1 Level Minimum required)With the following qualities:¬∑ With critical thinking and genuine passion for consumer behavior.¬∑ Proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.¬∑ Highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within technical and non-technical environments.¬∑ Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions. Permanent contract. The position can be based in our offices in Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Bcn) or Madrid. Hybrid office/remote.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAt Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!At Preply, we are continually enhancing the experience for both learners and tutors. To do this even more effectively, we've created a new cross-functional product squad!On one hand, we're here to empower our tutors, assisting them in delivering top-notch tutoring that enhances student retention and overall learning value.On the other hand, we aim to empower learners to keep the flame of learning alive even outside scheduled lessons. Our approach integrates lesson content into self-learning, ensuring tutors stay informed about student progress.Your primary responsibility will involve facilitating how we incorporate AI into the company. Selecting the most suitable ML modeling and generative AI tools for each specific problem and overseeing their integration within the product.What You‚Äôll Be DoingStay ahead of AI trends and contribute to shaping the future of AI-assisted tutoring and AI-driven learning in collaboration with our cross-functional product squad.Identifying user needs and leveraging third-party AI solutions to enhance the learning experience for both learners and tutors.Writing production code and developing pipelines when needed.Evaluate the quality of technical solutions in the area of AI/ML.Partner with the squad‚Äôs Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations.Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap.Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences.Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale.Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators.Effectively communicating your findings to technical and non-technical audiences.Support the technical growth of data scientists in your team or area of speciality.Leading the way in how we use AI throughout our product team. What You Need To SucceedExtensive experience in product data analytics and at least 3 years of previous experience as a Data Scientist.Having a solid understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI.Good and broad understanding of data analysis concepts such as (but not limited to) conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field.Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.).Experience and/or interest in extracting insights, identifying patterns, and uncovering trends from large datasets.Exhibiting strong curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to identify and address underlying problems.Emphasizing a creative mindset and proactively engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.Possessing strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Nice To HaveExperience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).Experience with NLP and Voice Recognition field.Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions.Experience in the areas of recommender systems.Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field.Have mentored others before. Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.  Diversity, Equity, And InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionWe are looking for a talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join the Logistics Data team in our Barcelona HQ.Data Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. Data scientists at Logistics own some of the most impactful models for the company, including our order dispatching engine, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, and all our time estimations models.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead Data Science projects that are central to the operations of the company.Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for themselves, having delivered on data science projects that have had significant impact. You have worked on cross-functional teams, managed stakeholders and provided mentorship when necessary. You are known in your team as a technical reference and you are interested in measurable results and high impact.THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time estimations models, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, dispatching engine improvements and optimisation.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsWork in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; lead a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, geospatial data science, reinforcement learning, statistical inference, time series analysis, mathematical optimisation.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling and SQL skills.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).Solid software engineering skills, and extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds. Working knowledge of agile development.Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesGOOD TO HAVEExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravingsüí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoVeeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company ‚Äì we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.Join us in transforming the life sciences industry , committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.The RoleLink is a pillar in the Veeva system landscape that envisions "Connecting life sciences and key people to improve research and care." Our product offers real-time academics, social, and medical data to build comprehensive profiles. These profiles help our life-science industry partners find the right experts to accelerate the development and the adoption of new therapeutics. We accelerate clinical trials and equitable care. We are proud that our work helps patients receive their most urgent care sooner.Your work will shape the product roadmap for the entire family of Link products, especially newer products such as Link for Trials. You will design and create an end-to-end pipeline to extract predefined categories of information from big unstructured data in multi-domain and multi-lingual setups. You will have access to cloud infrastructure to develop your model and support from a team of software developers and DevOps engineers to deploy it to production.We want to develop new algorithms to redefine the industry expectations for quality vs. quantity compromise. We train ML models empowered by over 1900 curators to meet both the quality and the scale requirements. descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department , based in Bangkok , oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityPlease note -The role will be based in Bangkok. We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world‚Äôs largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.In This Role, You‚Äôll Get toDesign, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readinessMine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovationWork with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best qualityResearch discover and harness new ideas that can make a differenceWhat You‚Äôll Need To Succeed4+ years hands-on data science experienceExcellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworksSignificant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or ScalaCan lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a teamGood communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environmentIt‚Äôs Great if You HavePhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systemsHands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/HadoopExperience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTAWe welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.#sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #doha #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #IT #4Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.Your MissionData Science, Machine Learning and Optimisation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs business. Data scientists at Logistics own some of the most impactful models for the company, including our order dispatching engine, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, and all our time estimations models.The Time Estimations team is tasked with training and serving real-time ML models for the duration of different milestones of an order, including the ETA shown to customers, the preparation time, and the arrival time of a courier to the pickup and delivery locations of an order. These estimations are key for optimizing our Logistics and for offering a great experience for our customers, partners, and couriers.In particular, they help us answer questions like how to match couriers and orders, when to notify partners and couriers of a new order, and what ETAs we show to our users (customers/partners and couriers). The impact you can have is massive: last year alone we were able to streamline the courier delivery by half a minute on average - saving Glovo millions of Euro in operational costs - among other key results.You'd be joining a multi-disciplinary team composed of Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Data Analysts. You would be responsible for the full lifecycle of the model development, productization, and deployment of our models, leveraging our Machine Learning Platform to streamline model training and deployment.As a Senior Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to lead Data Science projects that are central to the operations of the company.THE JOURNEYDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and optimisation modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time estimations models, demand forecasting models, supply and demand balancing optimisations, dispatching engine improvements and optimisation.Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsWork in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering and operations, amongst others.Mentor one or more data scientists; lead a small teamBe on top of new technologies and industry trends.Promote best in class standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry.What You Will Bring To The RideDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, geospatial data science, reinforcement learning, statistical inference, time series analysis, mathematical optimisation.Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:Strong data modeling and SQL skills.Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).Solid software engineering skills, and extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds. Working knowledge of agile development.Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesGOOD TO HAVEExperience in applying Data Science techniques to logistics problems.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or Statistics.Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.We Believe Driven Talent Deservesüåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAllot is an industry leader in network security and visibility. A global growing company in cyber-security with a strong Tier1 customer base. We embrace an Agile way of working, priding ourselves on being fast, diverse and dynamic. We are real team players who are ready to go the extra mile to succeed. This is your opportunity to develop, professionally and personallyWhat we‚Äôre looking for:Talented Cybersecurity Data Scientist to incorporate our cybersecurity group.What you‚Äôll do: Research and implement an identification/detection algorithms/signatures for encrypted traffic.Develop innovative models to improve the cybersecurity solutions of Allot products.Develop automation scripts and tools to aid in research and analysis tasks.What you should have: Solid competency in statistics, working knowledge of data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networksA motivated and creative problem solver, self-learning & results oriented.Experience with APIs, framework for Neuronal Network (TensorFlow, Torch)Good understanding of network architecture and protocols (e.g. SSL, HTTP).Experience with Linux environments.Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to C/C++ and Python.Desirable experienceMaster or Ph.D degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research or related technical field.2-3 years of work in Artificial Intelligence, Graph Theory, Natural Language Understanding, Machine Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, or Data Mining.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout GFT GroupAs a pioneer for digital transformation GFT develops sustainable solutions across new technologies ‚Äì from cloud engineering and artificial intelligence to blockchain/DLT.With its deep technological expertise, strong partnerships and comprehensive market know-how GFT offers advice to the financial and insurance sectors, as well as in the manufacturing industry. Founded in 1987 and located in more than 15 markets to ensure proximity to clients, the GFT team consists of over 10,000 determined talents. descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob Title - Chapter Lead ‚Äì Data Strategy & GovernanceWork location ‚Äì Barcelona (ES) or Maastricht (NL)Work set-up ‚Äì Hybrid (50% at office, 50% flexible)Are you a visionary leader in the field of data strategy and data management, with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Chapter Lead, Head of Group Data Office to lead our data strategy and data governance, to bring innovation and progress to life in our organization.The Chapter Lead is responsible for leading and developing a group of professionals within a specific area of expertise, known as a "chapter." You will play a crucial role in two main areas, managing people and playing a senior role in delivery.As a people manager, you will play a pivotal role in creating a highly engaged chapter by nurturing growth, fostering collaboration, and building a high-performance team. As a senior role in delivery, you will contribute to the success of platforms, products, or projects enabling business strategies.At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work, benefiting to our People, Customers & Communities and driving business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.Your key responsibiltiesLead a talented team of data professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence around data.Capability Management: Assessing and building current & future capabilities. Managing (internal & external) capacity and relationships. Ensuring the right utilization of chapter members.Senior delivery role: Contributing to business strategy by acting as a delivery lead, project manager for special assignment or, senior product manager.Facilitate the development and execution of a comprehensive data strategy, data governance framework, data operating model, and robust vision on a central data platform aligned with the dsm-firmenich‚Äôs objectives and growth initiatives.Lead Data Office and drive prioritization of data domains and allocation of resources. Secures and manages investment/budget for cross-domain data initiatives. Prepare data office and council agenda and ensure decisions and priorities taken at the data council are followed.Guide & support data domain Leaders across BUs/BPs with definition and implementations of their data domain, sub-domains, data strategy & data governance (e.g., data ownership, roles and responsibilities, and processes).Data Strategy and Data Architecture Alignment: collaborate closely with the Enterprise Data Architects to ensure that the data strategy translates into data capabilities and technical solutions that support the organization's data platform strategy.Promote senior sponsorship of data strategy and elevate the importance of data in the business strategyWe bringA rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose;A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected ‚Äì regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;You bringProven (+/- 8 years) of experience in data management and related disciplines.Data Governance Expertise: Profound knowledge of data governance principles, methodologies, and best practices, including data stewardship, data quality, and data privacy.Strong understanding of data enablement and digital transformation strategies with the ability to drive change and foster a data-driven culture.Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Fluent in English.Experience in developing data strategy, data operating model, and data governance framework and defining best practices.Experience in formalizing principles, processes, and standards within data governance.Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologiesSolid understanding of data privacy and security regulations topics (Certification is a plus!)The application processInterested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal. descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department , based in Bangkok , oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityPlease note -The role will be based in Bangkok. We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world‚Äôs largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.In This Role, You‚Äôll Get toDesign, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readinessMine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovationWork with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best qualityResearch discover and harness new ideas that can make a differenceWhat You‚Äôll Need To Succeed4+ years hands-on data science experienceExcellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworksSignificant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or ScalaCan lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a teamGood communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environmentIt‚Äôs Great if You HavePhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systemsHands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/HadoopExperience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTAWe welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.#sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #doha #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #IT #4Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales through our platform and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.YOUR MISSIONOur HR Operations Analyst will support the payroll team in the monthly payroll procedures to best fit our different demands making sure that we are meeting local laws and regulations over Europe in countries where we currently have activities.THE JOURNEYHandle payroll administration: collect all payroll-related information from managers & prepare, generate, check and submit payroll figures on a monthly basis Ensure any required adjustments are reflected in the payroll Taxes: help our employees with any tax-related questions and advise them on what could work better for them Payroll coordination ‚Äì be the intermediary between HR, Finance, Legal and the Outsourced Payroll Provider to ensure there is clear communication between departments for efficient payroll service Sick Leaves ‚Äì make sure all our employees provide the locally required documentation and make sure our payroll provider is informed Explain the payroll and benefits for all new hires and current employees Administer changes to salary, benefits, promotions, bonus, etc. Support the rest of the People team or any other department that needs it Help keep our colleagues happy! descripcion: Acerca del empleoClarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing social impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions. We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide. Clarity AI is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help us develop and deploy our NLP models at scale, so that we can continue to deliver the best quality sustainability data to our customers and partners. Machine Learning models are an integral part of Clarity AI‚Äôs strategy to provide transparent, accurate, consistent and high coverage metrics for impact investing, as efficiently as possible.This is an opportunity to join a team of talented and passionate Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers based in the UK, Europe and USA, working on models that have already demonstrated tremendous value in our products.Location The role is based in Spain, and can be fully remote.Way of Working: Remote or Hybrid Key ResponsibilitiesWorking as a Machine Learning Engineer you will be responsible for:Developing NLP models and pipelines to continue to improve our data and products.Working as part of a team using best practices (Git, CI/CD).Keeping up to date with the latest developments in NLP and MLE.Developing components of complex systems.RequirementsA relevant Master/ PhD. At least 2 years of experience at a similar position.Excellent oral and written English communication skills. (Minimum C1 level-proficient user) .Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about ML and NLP.The intellectual curiosity to keep learning new things.The honesty and integrity to know what you know and admit what you don‚Äôt.The ability to clearly advocate for a particular approach, and explain why.A tech stack that includes some or all of: Python, cloud (AWS), Git, CI/CD, containerization, DAGs, APIs, ML platforms, Deep Learning frameworks.Experience with Deep Learning NLP models in production is a plus.A Git profile that shows off your capabilities and interests is highly appreciated.BenefitsESOP / Phantom Stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity AI. That's why we allow them to participate in our success with ESOP or Phantom stock options. Empowered Learning: We value continuous learning development and allocate an annual training budget to support your professional growth. Premium Health Insurance: We provide access to one of the top health insurance plans in the market, powered by Cigna. Wellness and Fitness (Gympass): Access to your preferred and your favorite gyms and studios - as well as online live fitness classes, health & wellness apps, and virtual personal training sessions. Flexible Work Arrangements: We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options. For our hybrid work set-ups, we have offices in Madrid (complete with healthy food options and monthly office events), New York City, London, Paris, Riyadh, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces. Our CultureAt Clarity AI, we are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible. To learn more about working with us, please check out our LinkedIn page and visit our website. More about Clarity AIClarity AI‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur recognised as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by excellent leadership from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences. As well as teams of professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools. Clarity AI has received several awards: Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 The Forrester New Wave Leader: ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca MinguelaClarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

platform with more than 3 million contents in all formats (books, audiobooks, learning experiences, movies, courses...)Emotional wellbeing services: psychologist and emotional wellbeing
