descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob Title - Chapter Lead ‚Äì Data Strategy & GovernanceWork location ‚Äì Barcelona (ES) or Maastricht (NL)Work set-up ‚Äì Hybrid (50% at office, 50% flexible)Are you a visionary leader in the field of data strategy and data management, with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Chapter Lead, Head of Group Data Office to lead our data strategy and data governance, to bring innovation and progress to life in our organization.The Chapter Lead is responsible for leading and developing a group of professionals within a specific area of expertise, known as a "chapter." You will play a crucial role in two main areas, managing people and playing a senior role in delivery.As a people manager, you will play a pivotal role in creating a highly engaged chapter by nurturing growth, fostering collaboration, and building a high-performance team. As a senior role in delivery, you will contribute to the success of platforms, products, or projects enabling business strategies.At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work, benefiting to our People, Customers & Communities and driving business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.Your key responsibiltiesLead a talented team of data professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence around data.Capability Management: Assessing and building current & future capabilities. Managing (internal & external) capacity and relationships. Ensuring the right utilization of chapter members.Senior delivery role: Contributing to business strategy by acting as a delivery lead, project manager for special assignment or, senior product manager.Facilitate the development and execution of a comprehensive data strategy, data governance framework, data operating model, and robust vision on a central data platform aligned with the dsm-firmenich‚Äôs objectives and growth initiatives.Lead Data Office and drive prioritization of data domains and allocation of resources. Secures and manages investment/budget for cross-domain data initiatives. Prepare data office and council agenda and ensure decisions and priorities taken at the data council are followed.Guide & support data domain Leaders across BUs/BPs with definition and implementations of their data domain, sub-domains, data strategy & data governance (e.g., data ownership, roles and responsibilities, and processes).Data Strategy and Data Architecture Alignment: collaborate closely with the Enterprise Data Architects to ensure that the data strategy translates into data capabilities and technical solutions that support the organization's data platform strategy.Promote senior sponsorship of data strategy and elevate the importance of data in the business strategyWe bringA rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose;A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected ‚Äì regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;You bringProven (+/- 8 years) of experience in data management and related disciplines.Data Governance Expertise: Profound knowledge of data governance principles, methodologies, and best practices, including data stewardship, data quality, and data privacy.Strong understanding of data enablement and digital transformation strategies with the ability to drive change and foster a data-driven culture.Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Fluent in English.Experience in developing data strategy, data operating model, and data governance framework and defining best practices.Experience in formalizing principles, processes, and standards within data governance.Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologiesSolid understanding of data privacy and security regulations topics (Certification is a plus!)The application processInterested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal. For further information, please contact David van der Velden, Talent Acquisition Lead (david.velden-van@dsm-firmenich.com).Equal opportunities commitmentdsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there‚Äôs a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.dsm-firmenich is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. dsm-firmenich people are as diverse as our customers. For us that includes a commitment to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.About Dsm-firmenichAs innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world‚Äôs growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than ‚Ç¨12 billion. descripcion: Acerca del empleoAbout AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department , based in Bangkok , oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityPlease note -The role will be based in Bangkok. We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world‚Äôs largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.In This Role, You‚Äôll Get toDesign, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readinessMine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovationWork with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best qualityResearch discover and harness new ideas that can make a differenceWhat You‚Äôll Need To Succeed4+ years hands-on data science experienceExcellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworksSignificant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or ScalaCan lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a teamGood communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environmentIt‚Äôs Great if You HavePhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systemsHands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/HadoopExperience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTAWe welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.#sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #doha #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #IT #4Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoIf you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales through our platform and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.What makes our ride unique? ü§ù Our culture and strong values. We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. üí™Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.YOUR MISSIONOur HR Operations Analyst will support the payroll team in the monthly payroll procedures to best fit our different demands making sure that we are meeting local laws and regulations over Europe in countries where we currently have activities.THE JOURNEYHandle payroll administration: collect all payroll-related information from managers & prepare, generate, check and submit payroll figures on a monthly basis Ensure any required adjustments are reflected in the payroll Taxes: help our employees with any tax-related questions and advise them on what could work better for them Payroll coordination ‚Äì be the intermediary between HR, Finance, Legal and the Outsourced Payroll Provider to ensure there is clear communication between departments for efficient payroll service Sick Leaves ‚Äì make sure all our employees provide the locally required documentation and make sure our payroll provider is informed Explain the payroll and benefits for all new hires and current employees Administer changes to salary, benefits, promotions, bonus, etc. Support the rest of the People team or any other department that needs it Help keep our colleagues happy! Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a differenceWhat You Will Bring To The RideAt least 1 year of experience working in payroll Strong knowledge of payroll (international payroll preferred) Excellent data management skills - strong Excel and database management skills Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) in English and Spanish Proactive, hands-on, and eager to get your hands dirty! Detailed oriented ‚Äì you are a freak when it comes to details Always looking for ways to improve the process and optimizing coordination between colleagues An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. descripcion: Acerca del empleoClarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing social impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions. We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide. Clarity AI is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help us develop and deploy our NLP models at scale, so that we can continue to deliver the best quality sustainability data to our customers and partners. Machine Learning models are an integral part of Clarity AI‚Äôs strategy to provide transparent, accurate, consistent and high coverage metrics for impact investing, as efficiently as possible.This is an opportunity to join a team of talented and passionate Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers based in the UK, Europe and USA, working on models that have already demonstrated tremendous value in our products.Location The role is based in Spain, and can be fully remote.Way of Working: Remote or Hybrid Key ResponsibilitiesWorking as a Machine Learning Engineer you will be responsible for:Developing NLP models and pipelines to continue to improve our data and products.Working as part of a team using best practices (Git, CI/CD).Keeping up to date with the latest developments in NLP and MLE.Developing components of complex systems.RequirementsA relevant Master/ PhD. At least 2 years of experience at a similar position.Excellent oral and written English communication skills. (Minimum C1 level-proficient user) .Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about ML and NLP.The intellectual curiosity to keep learning new things.The honesty and integrity to know what you know and admit what you don‚Äôt.The ability to clearly advocate for a particular approach, and explain why.A tech stack that includes some or all of: Python, cloud (AWS), Git, CI/CD, containerization, DAGs, APIs, ML platforms, Deep Learning frameworks.Experience with Deep Learning NLP models in production is a plus.A Git profile that shows off your capabilities and interests is highly appreciated.BenefitsESOP / Phantom Stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity AI. That's why we allow them to participate in our success with ESOP or Phantom stock options. Empowered Learning: We value continuous learning development and allocate an annual training budget to support your professional growth. Premium Health Insurance: We provide access to one of the top health insurance plans in the market, powered by Cigna. Wellness and Fitness (Gympass): Access to your preferred and your favorite gyms and studios - as well as online live fitness classes, health & wellness apps, and virtual personal training sessions. Flexible Work Arrangements: We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options. For our hybrid work set-ups, we have offices in Madrid (complete with healthy food options and monthly office events), New York City, London, Paris, Riyadh, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces. Our CultureAt Clarity AI, we are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible. To learn more about working with us, please check out our LinkedIn page and visit our website. More about Clarity AIClarity AI‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur recognised as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by excellent leadership from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences. As well as teams of professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools. Clarity AI has received several awards: Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 The Forrester New Wave Leader: ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca MinguelaClarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

spoken.Experience with performance, load and/or penetration testing.Knowledge of DevOps tools such as Kubernetes, Docker and Jenkins.Experience with low code testing platforms.ISTQB Test Automation platform with more than 3 million contents in all formats (books, audiobooks, learning experiences, movies, courses...)Emotional wellbeing services: psychologist and emotional wellbeing app.Possibility of team sports activitiesFlexible Compensation Plans: Food, Transportation, Childcare, Training and Health insurance.A salary commensurate with track record and experienceReal descripcion: Acerca del empleoDescripci√≥n de la empresaDevoteam is a leading European consultancy focused on digital strategy, technology platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation through technology.Technology is in our DNA and we believe in it as a lever capable of driving change for the better, maintaining a balance that allows us to offer our client portfolio first class technological tools but always with the proximity and professionalism of a team that acts as a guide along the way.  Descripci√≥n del empleoDevoteam is a leading European consultancy focused on digital strategy, technology platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation through technology. We currently have more than 10,000 employees internationally, based in 18 countries. We have 25 years of experience in both local and international markets and more than 2000 satisfied customers. Find out more about Devoteam Spain here.At a technological level, we focus on 6 areas of specialisation, addressing the strategic challenges of our clients: Digital Business & Products, Data-driven Intelligence, Distributed Cloud, Business Automation, Trust & Cybersecurity & Sustainability enabled by digital.Devoteam G Cloud, Devoteam's Google Cloud solutions team, is a certified Managed Service Provider (MSP) and we are proud of our 8 Google Cloud Specialisations: Infrastructure, Machine Learning, Work Transformation - Enterprise, Application Development, Training Infrastructure, Training Data, Cloud Migration & Data Analytics. Devoteam G Cloud has 780 certifications in EMEA, 240 of them achieved in the last year (more than 100 in Iberia alone).In 2023, for the fourth consecutive year, Devoteam G Cloud has been recognised as Partner of the Year in EMEA for our outstanding achievements, selling Google Cloud products and building relationships to help transform our customers' businesses. In addition, at the 2022 Google Next Spain we were recognised as Partner of the Year locally.Our goal is to be the partner of choice for teams and technology creators in their quest for sustainable success. We guide our customers on their journey to the cloud and support them with our knowledge and experience, so our customer can focus on their business while we take care of the IT. Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team with experience in Cloud solutions?Take advantage of this unique opportunity to work for strategic, world-leading projects and customers. Take advantage of all our learning and certification opportunities. Work with renowned clients, as well as helping startups grow and shine in the tech world. And, of course, be sure to block out your schedule for fun team activities.  RequisitosWe are looking for a Google Cloud Data Engineer for an international team of data engineers.Duties and Responsibilities:Design, build and maintenance of ELT pipelines in Google Cloud.Design and implementation of logic for SQL data transformationsDeployment of infrastructure as codeContinuous integration and delivery (CICD) of product increments Development of data products within Agile teamsDocumentation of developed projects and proactive sharing of technical knowledge.Required Qualifications:Experience with Google Cloud services, especially BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Cloud Build, Workflows, Pub/Sub and Cloud Run.Advanced SQL knowledgeEnglish level B2 or higherPreferred Qualifications:Experience with Terraform, Dataform, Python, version control software (git) and Github.Google Cloud certificationsOther certificationsThe position is 100% remote from Spain and the incorporation is immediate.  Informaci√≥n adicionalPermanent contracts.Measures to reconcile work and family life: flexible working hours, intensive working hours on Fridays and during the summer months, spatial flexibility measures, aid and administrative procedures for maternity and paternity leave, participation in training activities, etc.).Access to the Flexible Remuneration Plan (Medical Insurance, Childcare Vouchers, Restaurant Ticket, Transport and Training Card).Free physiotherapy service at the head office.Assignment of a HRBP who will accompany you throughout your career, to support your professional and personal development during your service.English classes.Resources for Devoteamers (offers discounts to employees on purchases of goods, ticket bookings, travel, etc.).The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, for the promotion of its employees on the basis of their merits and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity and equality contribute to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organisation, contributing to the advancement of society. All our positions are open to all.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoEverything happens somewhere - which is why spatial analytics is fundamental to companies trying to understand the ‚Äúwhere‚Äù and the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù of their business. CARTO is the leading cloud-native location intelligence platform, trusted by data scientists, data analysts and developers from companies such as T-Mobile, Mastercard, NHL, Coca-Cola and Gap to provide geospatial insights for use cases such as site selection, geomarketing, route optimization, network planning and much more.With an exceptionally diverse team of 170 people spread across the US and Europe, CARTO (backed by Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, among others) is changing the way companies analyze location data - making it simple to do this straight out of modern, cloud data warehouses. Redefining its category, the company has grown rapidly in recent years, providing a compelling alternative to legacy GIS software.We are looking for a growth-focused, and results-driven Customer Success Engineer to work with CARTO‚Äôs most strategic customers to use location intelligence to solve their high-impact business needs. Our Customer Success Team ensures clients adopt and see value with CARTO. Our aim is to be trusted advisors to our customers ‚Äì helping solve business problems with CARTO solutions, managing accounts, and ensuring that customers love CARTO. This is a remote role and a advance level of Spanish and English is required.You will :Provide support on technical inquiries to our (GIS) customers through our support channels for our customers in AmericaAnalyze, triage and discuss with product management, engineering and design team members about providing clarity to our customers regarding their inquiriesDevelop technical examples for our customers and provide first-hand technical support, driving a high-impact resolutionProvide product demonstrations and share best practices with our customersPresent on technical topics related to the product, data, or GIS methods to the larger CARTO community and customer communitySupport the Customer Success Manager in building solutions using the CARTO productProblem solve to remove any blockers with advanced and complex use casesBe available to on-call requests for agreed shiftsYou offer:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Geography, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, GIS, or a related field2+ years of product support, professional or customer service experience in a similar position, supporting similar responsibilitiesProficient in modern cloud computing technologies, specifically Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft AzureExperience with Spatial Analysis using SQL in modern warehouses like BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, and DatabricksFamiliarity with different databases and data warehouse solutions (BigQuery, Snowflake, PostgreSQL) and with cloud ecosystems and infrastructure (Google Cloud, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes)Fluent in SQL and experience in at least one of the following languages: Python, JavaScriptExperience in the GIS ecosystemExperience troubleshooting issues of different or mixed nature from scratch and finding ways to reduce the severity of issues through alternative paths and coordinating with different internal stakeholders to meet our customers' expectationsFluent EnglishAutonomy, curiosity, eagerness to learn, and good energyWe offer:Competitive compensation.Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment.Excellent benefits, including 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees.Generous‚Äîreally generous‚Äîtime off, 401k with match, and stock options.Growth prospects at a truly welcoming, multicultural and multilingual company.A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we‚Äôre sharing it with the world.To ApplyDo you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO, we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you‚Äôre uncertain about whether you have the experience we‚Äôre looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, age, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq). Not the right job for you? Take a look at the rest of our openings at carto.com/careers

descripcion: Acerca del empleoüöóüö®Do you think that the automotive is your sector and also you love developing yourself as a R&D Governance Engineer?üö®üîåWe are seeking a highly skilled R&D Governance Engineer to join our team in Barcelona to work with one of the major providers of components and products for the automotive sectors worldwide, in a a very international environment impacting in teams related to high technology, mechanical, electronics and software. The ideal candidate will be responsible for establishing and maintaining effective governance processes within our Research and Development (R&D) department. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, project management skills, and a deep understanding of regulatory compliance. ¬øWhat would you be doing in your day a day? ‚ú® 1. R&D processes and Governance Framework Development:Design, implement, and maintain a robust governance framework for the R&D department to ensure effective decision-making, risk management, and compliance.2. Cross-Functional Collaboration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, legal, quality assurance, and regulatory affairs, to ensure alignment with governance processes.3.Continuous Improvement:Proactively identify areas for improvement in governance processes and recommend enhancements to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.4. Risk Management:Identify, assess, and manage risks associated with R&D projects, implementing mitigation strategies to safeguard project success. 5. descripcion: Acerca del empleoRENECO's mission is to implement a global conservation strategy aiming to restore and preserve the Houbara bustard populations of North Africa (Chlamydotis undulata undulata) and Asia (Chlamydotis macqueenii).To achieve these goals, RENECO has developed a multidisciplinary approach within different centers located in Morocco, Central Asia, and the Arabian Peninsula by combining fundamental and applied research.To cope with the expansion of its activities and due to the development of new conservation projects,RENECO is opening new positions giving a unique opportunity to be part of an ambitious conservation program.You will join the IT Department and you will be in charge mainly of supporting line-of-business applications and their users.Your main tasks will be:Analysis of business needs (breeding, veterinary, ecology) and writting of functional specificationsPropose appropriate solutions in line with the company strategyOptimization of Intranet business applications (data typing, management of technical term dictionaries, definition of input forms, configuration by back-office and under SQL Server) in close collaboration with service providers and partners.Maintenance and occasional development of legacy business applications, under AccessConsolidation of data from different production centers and BI/dashboarding (Tableau)Interfacing line of business data with those of department other than breeding/ecology: GIS (ESRI), ERP (Exact), BMS (WebCTRL), etc.Support for data curation and extraction (querying under SQL Server and Access)Writting support documents and activity reportsTraining and assistance for internal users of the line-of-business applicationsTechnical follow up of service providersMissions to be planned internationally.Profile:Education and certifications :Master (or bachelor with experience) in agronomy, ecology, biology or in the field of breeding or equivalent field; with good knowledge of T-SQL language and SQL Server or other relational database management system.Technical Skills:SQL Server and T-SQL languageActual experience of data management / treatment (not only database administration).A good knowledge of Access and VBA is an asset.Proficient in computer use (Windows, Office, Internet, utilities‚Ä¶)A first experience in BI, ideally with Tableau, is an asset.IT Skills:Basic knowledge in Python (or other language) coding is a plusBasic knowledge of system and network (Active Directory, IP, DNS‚Ä¶) is a plus.Basic knowledge of GIS (Esri ArcGIS Pro, ‚Ä¶) is a plus.Knowledge in descriptive statistics; basic knowledge in data mining / signal analysis are a plus.Language Skills:English required.Arabic, Russian, French, Kazakh, Uzbek, or Spanish is a plus.

descripcion: Acerca del empleo¬øQui√©nes somos?  More than just IT  OSP (Otto Group Solution Provider) is an IT service provider for retail and logistics with headquarters in Dresden. We live our passion for IT in an appreciative, trusting work environment. What drives us is the idea of working together as a team to achieve great things for our customers.  We rely on the personal responsibility and willingness to learn of our employees, on modern technologies and high quality in software development. Agile working, transparent decisions, a lively feedback culture and collegial cooperation make us successful.  We are active for customers inside and outside the Otto Group. With over 450 employees at several German and international locations, we have been developing flexible software and BI solutions since 1991 and are thus shaping the shopping worlds of tomorrow. We are part of the Otto Group and share a value system that focuses on responsible and sustainable action.  What will you do? You will be part of the team responsible for the cross-company "Data Supply Chain" in the Otto Group to ensure the data supply of novel, data-driven business models.You will be responsible, with your expertise, of the increasing for the usability and impact of our data platform for real-time and batch processing within the group.Together with your colleagues, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of our new, high-performance and robust BI platform in the Google Cloud for big, fast & smart data. 100% Cloud only.In addition to processing and preparing the data along its entire lifecycle in our data pipelines of data stream processing, you will also create tools & frameworks for the efficient use of the new BI platform.You will be working in an international environment with our German and Spanish colleagues.  What‚Äôs your story? You will design and develop reports using BI tools and technologies such as Power BI .Strong understanding of the stakeholder‚Äôs strategic goals and the ability to align report development accordingly.Excellent analytical skills to identify key information needed by different departments and users.Proven track record of creating reports that drive actionable insights and improve business efficiency.Proficiency in data visualization concepts and techniques to present data in a clear and meaningful manner.Strong problem-solving abilities to address performance bottlenecks and optimize report loading times.Basic developer skills in SQL (e.g. Terraform, Google Dataflow), in scalable cloud solutions based on Google or other cloud providers.Confident handling of relational databases (e.g. BigQuery ) and concepts of data warehousing and data modelling (e.g. DataVault beneficial) as well as initial knowledge of real-time technologies.You are characterized by team spirit, initiative and self-organization and strong communication skills.Fluent in written and spoken English .Curiosity, self-initiative and you like to work in a team and have fun at work !  Benefits Permanent contractFlexible working hours (you decide how to organize your day to day!)Hybrid work mode (work from home up to 80% of the time, having the rest to meet you colleagues at the office!)You will be part of a fast growing company, being part of a great teamCompetitive salaryFlexible retributionMedical insuranceAgile working methodsTraining and Development: we have a clear focus on technical innovation, but we don‚Äôt forget the personal growth!

herramientas: ['Buena pr√°ctica cl√≠nica', 'Control m√©dico', 'Datos cl√≠nicos', 'Desarrollo cl√≠nico', 'Ensayos cl√≠nicos', 'Limpieza de datos', 'Planes de desarrollo', 'Presentaciones regulatorias', 'Protocolo', 'Revisi√≥n de datos']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoAstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious diseases. We are more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.AstraZeneca has a multifaceted environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build talent.Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of six scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programsThe Global Development Scientist Director is an important part of the Clinical Project Team (CPT), and Global Study Team (GST) working harmoniously and cross functionally (in a matrix environment) with other CPT & GST members, Site Management & Monitoring (SMM), field-based liaisons, and site personnel. The Senior Global Development Scientist Director and counterpart Global Development Medical Director work collaboratively in the clinical aspects underpinning a product.This includes shared responsibility with Clinical Operations team members in the planning and execution, including recruitment and delivery of a clinical study. Accountabilities include clinical support for the development and implementation of early phase AstraZeneca sponsored clinical program strategies. As such, you will provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA).The Global Development Scientist Director may also provide expert input or lead functional process improvement initiatives and provide contributions to cross-asset or cross-indication area working groups depending on the level of experience.This position demands strong collaborative communication skills, including the ability to engage with and influence a diverse range of stakeholders both within and external to AstraZeneca. The individual will operate according to the highest ethical standards in compliance with internal SOPs, local regulations, laws and adhere to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and regulatory requirements.Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team.Work cross functionally within CPT to ensure the clinical strategy is translated into the development of the study concept document, study protocol and related documents; Establish key relationships internally with clinical project teams, and externally with regulatory bodies and external service providers.Provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA).Accountable for the relevance and accuracy of clinical science underpinning of clinical study based on detailed scientific review and consultation, for the clinical and scientific leadership and integrity of protocols and/or components of clinical plans and for the delivery of final protocol and its governance approval.Lead the development of the protocol and related documents and the development and delivery of the clinical study report to meet GCP, ICH and all AstraZeneca quality standards.Lead cross functional projects to ensure the successful passage of drugs through all phases of the drug development process, or contribute to one or more elements of such a project as a technical expert.Review and interpret medical data and clinical trial data and come up with conclusionsResponsible for timely responses to investigational study sites for local ICF changes, protocol & EC/IRB questions/requests.Support the development of clinical components of regulatory and EC/IRB submission documents for instances where marketing approval is warranted. Prepare and provide input to clinical study reports (CSRs) and clinical portions of Regulatory Documents (e.g., IB, DSUR, PSUR, regulatory responses)Contribute to development and delivery of face to face or virtual investigator and supervise training Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical teamParticipate or lead as needed the review and assessment of new opportunities and ESRs.Mentor less experienced Global Development Scientist DirectorsMinimum Qualifications: BS required, PhD in a scientific field, PharmD or MD is strongly preferredMinimum of 7 years of relevant experienceSignificant Industry or Academic experience in drug development required with significant experience in malignant Haematology clinical trials strongly preferred.Sufficient technical knowledge (haemato-oncology background preferred) to be able to interact with confidence with internal and external partnerPossesses sound foundational knowledge of FDA and other major country regulations and detailed knowledge of Good Clinical Practice other regulations governing clinical research.Possesses general knowledge of 1) medical monitoring 2) Regulatory approval process in relevant countries; 3) pharmaceutical industry/R&D operations; 4) marketing and commercial fundamentals.Drug Development/Clinical Development Planning: Demonstrates a consistent track record to both independently complete, and lead peers in completion in components of sophisticated plans, related documents, appropriate methodologies, measures, analytical plans and evaluation tools.Ability to drive/contribute to protocol design, writing and implementationWorking at AstraZenecaHere you‚Äôll have the chance to create a substantial difference to patients‚Äô lives! With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines ‚Äì for the world‚Äôs most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and crafting the patient ecosystem.Next Steps? Apply now!AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.Find out more and follow AstraZeneca on: LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionProcurement Marketing Category Specialist; Experiential CategoryLocation: London, Edinburgh, Glasgow, or MadridPermanent About The RoleThe Diageo Europe Marketing Procurement team has always been a significant contributor towards Diageo productivity and growth goals and considered a trusted and respected partner internally and externally. Most recently, the Europe Procurement Team came together to review its ambition for the next 2-3 years and has a very clear strategy to exponentially increase the value it brings to Diageo, and also very importantly, how it brings that value.The new strategic priorities have been clearly identified as next generation of investment optimization, continuing to build the appropriate networks, driving a step change in customer sufficiency, enhancing digitalization opportunities, and very prominently accelerating the delivery of our ESG ambition. Diageo Europe includes the Market clusters of Great Britain, Ireland, Northern Europe, Southern Europe, Eastern Europe, MENA (Middle East North Africa) and Turkiye.Experiential Marketing includes sampling, events/roadshows and at/in home events to drive memorable engagement and experiences with consumers and value for customers. The Category Specialist Experiential Marketing will be a member of a team of Category Specialists working directly with Europe Category Managers and Global Category Managers.As a key person in our dedicated team, your focus in this role is: To apply strategic procurement excellence, through creation and deployment of Europe Category Strategy built on Diageo‚Äôs best methods, standards, and tools, to deliver procurement value and embed a cost consciousness culture that supports investment optimization in Experiential Marketing categories. Leading sourcing activities, cost modelling, contract management, supplier relationship management, supplier innovation and supplier development activity using best in class processes and ways of working.Delivery of Diageo's Society 2030 ambition.To deploy category management techniques to avoid wastage and pursue outstanding spend practices Lead and implement ongoing supplier performance initiatives through performance key performance indicators and service level agreements and application of a robust supplier review mechanism within a total contract ownership approach. Driving category excellence through execution of improve projects in line with the categories strategic objectives.Pro-actively Collaborate with partners building towards full engagement across all Europe markets Adhere to and always promote the highest standards of compliance. This includes risk management processes and contract management. Generate insights and have good commercial foresight to objectively challenge established practice to stimulate alternative thinking and influence decision-making.About YouThe following skills and experience are required:A dynamic individual with the ability to thrive in an agile and fast-paced environment while finding clarity in ambiguous situations by stimulating alternative thinking. descripcion: Acerca del empleoVIKO es una Digital-Business Factory especializada en conectar oportunidades digitales desde 1999. ¬øC√≥mo lo hacemos? Uniendo ideas, personas y recursos para lograr una √∫nica misi√≥n: crear valor con valores.Este holding, actualmente, est√° formado por:‚ö°Elogia (agencia de marketing digital), ‚ö°Marketing4eCommerce (medio de comunicaci√≥n online especializado en el ecosistema digital), ‚ö°M4C Academy (formaci√≥n online), ‚ö°Tandem Up (consultor√≠a especializada en Marketplaces), ‚ö°Kraz (consultor√≠a de anal√≠tica avanzada), ‚ö°Kaibos (Amazon brand builder),‚ö°Candee (consultora de talento Candidate First especializada en talento digital) y ‚ö°Optopus (agencia especializada en soluciones avanzadas para optimizar el punto de venta digital).Contaba Oriol Ch√≠as, nuestro CTO, y nuestro Digital Warrior n√∫mero 0, que VIKO naci√≥ porque un grupo de personas que se entend√≠an y que se lo pasaban bien quer√≠an trabajar juntas. Como Technical Digital Analyst, te unir√°s a un equipo experto en servicios y tecnolog√≠as de marketing digital, y participar√°s en proyectos relacionados con tecnolog√≠as web, trabajando proyectos enfocados en comercio digital. La tipolog√≠a de tareas puede variar d√≠a a d√≠a puesto que podr√°s participar en diferentes proyectos transversales o dar apoyo a diferentes equipos dentro de la organizaci√≥n.¬øC√≥mo es el equipo con el que trabajar√°s? üêôFormar√°s parte de una Direcci√≥n de Servicios a Cliente, donde te rodear√°s de profesionales que llevan la innovaci√≥n en su ADN y que se vuelcan en enamorar a su cliente. Estas personas tienen conocimiento especializado en distintas √°reas especializadas del marketing digital: Market Intelligence, SEO, UX, Anal√≠tica, Marketing Automation, Social & Content MK y Paid Media. Adem√°s, tendr√°s siempre el acompa√±amiento de tu Hub Leader, que ser√° responsable de la gesti√≥n del conocimiento dentro del Hub de DataTech, del que formar√°s parte.¬øY c√≥mo lo har√°s? üìÖColaborar√°s en el mantenimiento y el desarrollo de herramientas internas (10% de tu d√≠a a d√≠a) y webs (especialmente ecommerce).Implementar√°s scripts para la medici√≥n de datos, especialmente a trav√©s de tag containers (sobre todo Google Tag Manager).Colaborar√°s en la implementaci√≥n t√©cnica y en la configuraci√≥n de cualquier herramienta de medici√≥n (especialmente Google Analytics).Gestionar√°s datos de campa√±as, colaborando en la extracci√≥n, transformaci√≥n e integraci√≥n de datos de campa√±as y de las diferentes fuentes de datos (Funnel, Metricool, etc), encarg√°ndote de tratarlos, limpiarlos y cargarlos en las diferentes herramientas de informes (Looker Studio).Colaborar√°s en la carga y consulta de datos en data warehouses, especialmente BigQuery.Participar√°s en proyectos de automatizaci√≥n de procesos.Solucionar√°s incidencias t√©cnicas que reporten los clientes u otros departamentos.Pero, antes de seguir, ¬°queremos que conozcas nuestro secreto! ¬øPor qu√© nuestrxs Digital Warriors se sienten como en casa? üè† Mejor no te lo contamos nosotrxs, ¬°esto es todo lo que dicen ellxs!üíó Por las personas y por el buen ambiente que se respira. Nos gusta lo que hacemos, nos ayudamos los unxs a los otrxs, nos divertimos, y hacemos de cada d√≠a una aventura.‚è∞ Por la flexibilidad y la conciliaci√≥n para que haya un equilibrio trabajo-vida personal.ü™Å Por la confianza que se tiene en cada persona, dando la libertad, el empoderamiento y la responsabilidad de liderar proyectos y llevarlos al √©xito, siempre bajo la filosof√≠a ‚ÄúLearning by doing‚Äù.üìà Por los proyectos retadores y el aprendizaje continuo de la mano de clientes top (Nestl√©, Reckitt, Beam Suntory, Taurus...), y de las personas expertas de la casa.üéØ Por el crecimiento profesional y el acompa√±amiento gracias a las sesiones de Mentoring, que nos ayudan a lograr nuestras metas y a hacer brillar nuestras habilidades. No obstante, las oficinas est√°n abiertas de lunes a viernes para que puedan ser utilizadas. En VIKO, nos comprometemos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente de la etnia, religi√≥n, sexo, origen nacional, orientaci√≥n sexual, edad, estado civil, discapacidad, g√©nero, identidad o expresi√≥n de g√©nero.#internship #technicaldigitalanalyst #javascript #php #html #cms #developer #data

descripcion: Acerca del empleoJob DescriptionThe Enterprise/ Solution Architect will play an pivotal role in driving the Ford Credit Europe (FCE) strategic transformation efforts. You will work with multiple teams to help them in their migration from existing legacy systems to modern cloud-based platforms. Your expertise in financial organisations, cloud technology and enterprise architecture will be instrumental in guiding our modernisation efforts and ensuring a seamless transition for both our business partners and our banking customers. As part of this role you will work with both engineering product teams and senior business managers to help define both the technical and business strategy at an enterprise level.Responsibilities Help develop future strategic solutions, collaborating with business stakeholders, IT product teams and external partners  Develop and maintain architecture artefacts including roadmaps and current / future state designs following industry standard architecture models such as TOGAF  Design transitional architectures to help product teams on their modernisation journeys and guide teams through required enterprise architecture processes ensuring alignment with banking standards.  Provide technical leadership and guidance to product teams, overseeing implementation of architecture designs and sharing your experience QualificationsKnowledge, Skills & Abilities Experience of leading cross functional teams through large scale technology transformation initiatives within the financial industry  Proven track record as an Enterprise Architect, experience of helping to implement successful modernisation projects and migrating existing applications to the cloud  Strong knowledge of cloud computing platforms, specifically Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services and associated best practices  Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with strong emphasis on follow through, whilst managing your own workload.  Proficiency in developing Enterprise / Solution Architecture artefacts using standard architecture frameworks such as TOGAF / Zachman  Knowledge of modern application technologies and platforms such as SalesForce, AEM, MFEs, Graph, Apollo, React  Knowledge of Security and identity management architecture standards  Familiarity with modern software development methodologies, DevOps practices and agile / SAFE frameworks  Implementation knowledge of common FinTech Core Banking platforms  Understanding of legacy platforms such as Java Weblogic, AS400 and DB2 Qualifications & Background Google Professional Cloud Architect certification.  Degree in computer science/ engineering, Data science or related field  5+ years experience in Enterprise / Solution / Cloud Architecture  Strong understanding of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Additional Information Due to the nature of the work, which may be driven by strict deadlines, there will be an occasional requirement to work flexible hours, which may include evenings and/or weekends.  Our products are used worldwide, therefore occasional trips abroad may also be required. The role is based in Madrid (Spain) with allowance of partial teleworking.Ford is committed to diversity and equality of opportunity for all and is opposed to any form of less favourable treatment or harassment on the grounds of gender, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnic origin, colour, nationality, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, religion/belief, gender reassignment and gender identity, age and those with caring responsibilities.

herramientas: ['Altair', 'Calibradores', 'Capacidad de an√°lisis', 'Comunicaci√≥n', 'Documentaci√≥n', 'Hypermesh', 'Hyperworks', 'M√©todo de los elementos finitos (MEF)', 'Optistruct', 'Revisi√≥n de dise√±os']
descripcion: Acerca del empleoReq ID: 427935At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.Could you be the full-time Calculation Engineer in Barcelona we‚Äôre looking for?Your future roleTake on a new challenge and apply your calculation expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You‚Äôll work alongside young and proactive teammates.You'll perform discipline activities and deliverables on project taking into account applicable instructions/processes and other specific Customer (internal or external) requirements. Day-to-day, you‚Äôll work closely with teams across the business (project management, engineering), define load cases according to applicable standards, either static and cycle loads; as well as boundary conditions and much more.You‚Äôll specifically take care of performing the calculation discipline activities and producing associated deliverables in compliance with QCD commitments, but also creating meshed models from CATIA 3D models, with either 1D, 2D or 3D finite elements, with Hypermesh software.We‚Äôll look to you for: Performing the Finite Element Analysis in Hyperworks software.  Analysing calculated deformations,stresses and vibration modes obtained.  Suggesting design improvements of calculated parts  Defining gauges position for strain gauge test with full scale parts  Preparing and documenting calculation discipline reports, calculation notes showing FEA conclusions, according to project schedule and following-up the main open actions.  Performing correlation analysis with test results.  Preparing and documenting Mechanical Domain Design Reviews  Updating Calculation Notes taking into account Change Requests.  Complying with QCD commitments and reporting on calculation discipline activities progress and alerting relevant N+1 in case of issue potentially impacting achievement of QCD commitments  Applying discipline rules, processes and tools and ensuring discipline calculation deliverables quality and their acceptance by the Customer (internal) within committed limits  Suggesting design improvements of calculated parts  QCD commitments.  Managing calculation discipline FEA engineers on Project (external).  Perform quotation of engineering workpackage , upon request  Defining Project Mechanical Decomposition (PBS)  Supporting Sourcing, Industrialization and Manufacturing teams during Production ramp-up.  Collaborating with MDL for continuous improvement of the Domain (including RoE) All About YouWe value passion and attitude over experience. That‚Äôs why we don‚Äôt expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we‚Äôve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role: Mechanical Engineering.  Mechanical Engineering preferably applied to Railway products with more than 2 years of experience.  Good Communications and interpersonal skills including with third parties (customer).  Time management and reporting skill.  Sense of urgency / priority.  Structured and organised with Hands-on approach.  English operational in read/writing and technical meeting.  Finite Elements Analysis proved experience for more than 2 years  Knowledge and experience with Altair Hyperworks softwares (Hypermesh, Hyperview, Hypergraph‚Ä¶) for more than one year.  Knowledge and experience with solver OptiStruct for more than one year. Things you‚Äôll enjoy Join us on a life-long transformative journey ‚Äì the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You‚Äôll also: Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines  Work with rolling stock cutting-edge projects  Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues  Contribute to innovative projects  Utilise our cooperative working environment  Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries  Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning  Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage You don‚Äôt need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you‚Äôll be proud. If you‚Äôre up for the challenge, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.

This is a broad scoped role, suited to those with a track record of leading small analytics function and/or creating new and high impact business verticals from scratch, from a consulting, sales or business development background with a strong entrepreneurial mindset. You will be expected to perform opportunity sizing on new business opportunities, build high level business cases to justify your proposals and work closely with Product teams to build out new features and functionalities prior to dealing directly with external partners to negotiate and close deals.We are seeking a Manager/Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights, to lead strategic and operational initiatives that create both growth and efficiency for the Supply department. In this role, you will work directly with multiple stakeholders, including executive leadership and various cross-functional departments to successfully implement key initiatives. You will impact Agoda‚Äôs business through exploring new business opportunities, analyzing complex scaling challenges, and improve existing operations.The Opportunity:In this Role, you‚Äôll get to: General: This role is a blend of hands on ‚Äòin the business‚Äô and executive level ‚Äòon the business‚Äô work. behaviorsAnalytics & Alerts: Quantitative analysis, data mining and presentation of business metrics; identify drivers and build an end-to-end communication framework based on business value, effort external reports and present key datasets to enable all team members to efficiently and effectively monitor performance and prioritize their effortsLeadership: Lead a small team of experts to deliver the above functions and be excited by the challenge of mentoring team members across the chain and connectivity teams What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:6+ years of leadership experience in analytics/data descripcion: Acerca del empleo#Be MoreDo you aspire to a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company. Work with the world‚Äôs most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!Main missionReporting to the Deal Desk Team Lead, the Deal Desk Analyst will be responsible for supporting our client¬¥s group of sales representatives (Silicon Valley Digital Giant), by helping them to navigate the complexities of our client's sales and fulfillment processes.Being the first point of contact for the sales reps you will be answering questions, giving advice, and solving problems using your technical knowledge and expertise. As a successful Deal Desk Analyst, you will become an expert in core operations and operational chance, truly understanding the nuts and bolts of a SaaS business and sales life cycle.Responsibilities:Provide consultative support/troubleshooting to sales reps who will create cases using a CRM when (back office) support is required.To resolve the case within the agreed SLA (Service Level Agreement) which will change depending on the case type.Meet or exceed defined targets related to response & resolution times.Educate sales reps on processes, and best practices, to improve performance and release sales capacity to core sales activities.Build working relationships cross-functionally that will help resolve special requests from the sales team.Be an expert in our client's CRM and ERP Systems.Follow up with Sales Reps & cross-functional teams to retrieve the required information in order to solve cases quickly and in accordance with our client's sales policies.Ensure Sales Reps follow our client's guidelines and sales policies while moving opportunities through the sales life cycle.RequirementsAbility to communicate confidently with tech-savvy customers using perfect written and spoken English.Understanding of Sales Order processing & Customer Support Operations.The ability to navigate and progress the sales process through long, complex sales cycles.Excellent communication, organizational, detailed oriented, and client-service skills.To read the case notes and be able to fully understand & identify the request received.Experience in Back Office, Customer Service, and/or office call center environment is a plus.Ability to work independently and to multi-task, set priorities, and manage time effectively.Ability to work effectively with clients and cross-functional teams.Ability to provide meaningful insights from data.Strong time management skills and motivation to exceed expectations. But nothing beats the commitment to yourself to be as good as you possibly can. We will help you to achieve this goal.Problem-solving skills and the ability to ‚ÄúThink outside of the box‚Äù to offer creative solutions.To take full ownership and responsibility for the cases you are working on during their ‚ÄúLife cycle‚Äù.Good command of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook & Teams) & CRMs.Punctuality. Your clients and teammates are counting on you to be here, every day.Top reasons to work here:Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentivesComprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverageWorld-class workspacesEngaging activities and recognition programsStrong learning and development plans for your career growthA positive culture for you to #BeMore at workEasy-to-locate area with direct access to public transportFlexible working arrangementsBe coached and mentored by experts in your fieldJoin a global company, winner of hundreds of industry awards

descripcion: Acerca del empleoTUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Customer Hub & Common Analytics Domain is a global team within TUI technology responsible for Marketing & Technology Analytics. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.At TUI we are ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.The Machine Learn Engineer is responsible to Develop, implement, and maintain machine learning models and algorithm working closely with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into production systems.About The JobAs a Machine Learning Operations Engineer your expertise will be pivotal in designing and implementing scalable infrastructure for deploying, monitoring, and managing machine learning models in production. Collaborate closely with data engineers and data scientists, contributing to the seamless streamlining of the deployment process. Your role extends to implementing automated testing and continuous integration/delivery pipelines, ensuring the efficiency and reliability of machine learning models throughout their lifecycle. Uphold the highest standards of security and compliance in all aspects of machine learning systems. As a trouble shooter extraordinaire, you will identify and resolve issues related to model deployment and performance, ensuring a robust and stable production environment. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is inherent in your role, aligning ML Ops processes with overall business goals for maximum impact. About YouProficiency in scripting languages like Python or Bash. Experience with containerization tools such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Knowledge of DevOps practices and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and their machine learning services. Strong understanding of model monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting in a production environment. Collaboration skills to work with data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders. Excellent communication skills and the ability to document processes. Experience with model versioning and model registry tools. Knowledge of MLOps tools such as MLflow or Kubeflow. Understanding of security practices in machine learning deployment. Previous experience with managing and deploying models in edge computing environments. Certifications in cloud platforms and/or DevOps practices. About Our OfferWorking in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts, special offersMobile working, flexible working hours, and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: TUI Way of Working Health and Wellbeing support in five key areas ‚Äì Health, Social, Community, Career and FinancialDevelopment and career opportunities: We offer a wide range of digital training and international career opportunities.Additional benefits relevant to the local market that you'll be based inAt TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to. We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click hereIf you have any questions, please contact the Recruiter for this role via the contact information included in the advert.Please Note: These vacancies will be managed by an International Recruitment Team and therefore your application may be viewed by TUI colleagues outside your home country.

descripcion: Acerca del empleoTelespazio Ib√©rica forma parte del Grupo Telespazio, uno de los principales actores mundiales en soluciones y servicios satelitales. Con ra√≠ces cartogr√°ficas y m√°s de 20 a√±os de experiencia en soluciones territoriales para grandes corporaciones e instituciones, Telespazio Ib√©rica es una empresa de referencia a nivel europeo en el sector de Nuevas Tecnolog√≠as aplicadas al Territorio. Telespazio Ib√©rica ofrece servicios que cubren el ciclo completo desde la generaci√≥n del dato cartogr√°fico con las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as, hasta el desarrollo de soluciones inform√°ticas combinando Sistemas de Informaci√≥n Geogr√°ficos (SIG), telecomunicaciones y dispositivos m√≥viles.El √°mbito de la gesti√≥n y observaci√≥n de la Biodiversidad, donde Telespazio es ya un actor clave en mercado Europeo (programa Copernicus de la Uni√≥n Europea), un nuevo programa de I+D+i permitir√° desarrollar nuevos Servicios Geoespaciales basados en la combinaci√≥n de UAS (veh√≠culos no tripulados) y sat√©lites, as√≠ como la evoluci√≥n en las tecnolog√≠as de navegaci√≥n avanzadas para UTM y U-Space.En este contexto y a fin de cubrir las necesidades de este nuevo programa, Telespazio Ib√©rica selecciona para su departamento de TI a Ingenieros Inform√°ticos de Software con experiencia como Analista (T√©cnico y Funcional) para colaborar en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, Vigo o Madrid o en la oficina del proyecto en Fuerteventura.El candidato contribuir√°, en coordinaci√≥n directa con el Jefe del Proyecto de Desarrollo, mediante la realizaci√≥n de las distintas funciones:- Soporte en la Recogida de requisitos, an√°lisis funcional, planificaci√≥n y gesti√≥n.- Dise√±o funcional y t√©cnico de los desarrollos a implementar, dise√±o de la arquitectura de sistemas y base de datos, elaboraci√≥n de documentaci√≥n t√©cnica (arquitectura, base de datos, procesos, informes, manuales de operaci√≥n, gesti√≥n y usuario)- Interrelaci√≥n con las √°reas usuarias en lo referente a sus proyectos asignados- Direcci√≥n de los programadores asignados (supervisi√≥n de los desarrollos y pruebas realizadas)Se ofrece: ¬∑ Estabilidad y crecimiento profesional¬∑ Buen ambiente de trabajo¬∑ Formaci√≥n en horario y centro de trabajo¬∑ Teletrabajo parcialRequisitos:Estudios m√≠nimos: Grado universitario en inform√°tica o equivalente. Deseable M√°ster en Cloud Computing, Data Science, Big Data, o rama relacionadaExperiencia m√≠nima: Al menos 4 a√±os en desarrollo de softwareResidente en: Imprescindible en Espa√±a preferiblemente en CanariasRequisitos m√≠nimos:Conocimientos o desarrollo de Servicios web y/o algoritmos con PythonConocimientos avanzados en SQL (Oracle, PosgreSQL)Conocimientos de Front End (Javascript/Typescript)CI/CD (Gitlab, Jenkins)Conocimientos de Arquitecturas Cloud Computing (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)Requisitos deseados:Conocimientos de Machine Learning / IALenguajes de programaci√≥n anal√≠ticos y de manejo de datos en entornos Big Data (spark, pyspark, rspark). Competencias:Proactividad, esp√≠ritu de equipo, disponibilidad para viajes eventualesOrientaci√≥n al clienteCapacidades organizativas y de motivaci√≥n del equipoTelespazio Iberica apuesta y fomenta la inclusi√≥n de personas con discapacidad valorando estas candidaturas en sus procesos de selecci√≥n. La presente oferta de empleo est√° redactada teniendo en cuenta la imparcialidad y no discriminaci√≥n por raz√≥n de g√©nero, raza, ideolog√≠a o cualquier otro motivo.
